
Hymns, #1
Blessing of the Trinity - His Plan

E1 C1 K1 S1 T1

Lyrics
:
J. F. Garland
Music
:
Ira D. Sankey
Meter
:
8.5.8.3

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
 
 1  Glory be to God the Father,
 1     And to Christ the Son,
 1  Glory to the Holy Spirit -
 1     Ever One.
 
 2  As we view the vast creation,
 2     Planned with wondrous skill,
 2  So our hearts would move to worship,
 2     And be still.
 
 3  But, our God, how great Thy yearning
 3     To have sons who love
 3  In the Son e'en now to praise Thee,
 3     Love to prove!
 
 4  'Twas Thy thought in revelation,
 4     To present to men
 4  Secrets of Thine own affections,
 4     Theirs to win.
 
 5  So in Christ, through His redemption
 5     (Vanquished evil powers!)
 5  Thou hast brought, in new creation,
 5     Worshippers!
 
 6  Glory be to God the Father,
 6     And to Christ the Son,
 6  Glory to the Holy Spirit -
 6     Ever One.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #2
Blessing of the Trinity - His Revelation

E2 C2 K2 S- T2

Lyrics
:
S. McCallum
Music
:
E. Carren
Meter
:
12.13.12.10

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3 
 
 1  Glory, glory, glory, praise and adoration!
 1  Hear the anthems swelling out thro' all eternity!
 1  Father, Son, and Spirit - God in revelation -
 1     Prostrate each soul before the Deity!
 
 2  Father, source of glory, naming every fam'ly;
 2  And the Son upholding all by His almighty power;
 2  Holy Spirit, filling the vast scene of glory -
 2     O glorious Fullness, let our hearts adore!
 
 3  God supreme, we worship now in holy Splendor,
 3  Head of the vast scene of bliss, before Thy face we fall!
 3  Majesty and greatness, glory, praise and power
 3     To Thee belong, eternal Source of all!
 
Verses:  1   2   3

Hymns, #3
Blessing of the Trinity - His Reign

E3 C- K- S- T3

Lyrics
:
Unknown
Music
:
Felice de Giardini
Meter
:
6.6.4.6.6.6.4

Hymn using same tune:
#179
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  Come, Thou Almighty King,
 1  Help us Thy name to sing,
 1     Help us to praise.
 1  Father, all glorious,
 1  O'er all victorious,
 1  Come, and reign over us,
 1     Ancient of Days.
 
 2  Come, Thou incarnate Word,
 2  Gird on Thy mighty sword,
 2     Our prayer attend:
 2  Come, and Thy people bless,
 2  And give Thy word success;
 2  Spirit of holiness,
 2     On us descend.
 
 3  Come, holy Comforter,
 3  Thy sacred witness bear
 3     In this glad hour:
 3  Thou who Almighty art,
 3  Now rule in every heart,
 3  And ne'er from us depart,
 3     Spirit of power.
 
 4  To Thee, great One in Three,
 4  Eternal praises be
 4     Hence evermore.
 4  Thy sov'reign majesty
 4  May we in glory see,
 4  And to eternity
 4     Love and adore.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4

Hymns, #6

:
Reginald Heber
Music
:
John B. Dykes
Meter
:
12.13.12.10

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3 
 
 1  Holy, Holy, Holy, Lord God Almighty!
 1  Unto everlasting days our song shall rise to Thee;
 1  Holy, Holy, Holy, Merciful and Mighty!
 1  God in Three Persons, blessed Trinity!
 
 2  Holy, Holy, Holy! All the saints adore Thee;
 2  Heaven's elders cast their crowns down by the glassy sea;
 2  Cherubim and seraphim worship too before Thee,
 2  Who wert, and art, and evermore shalt be.
 
 3  Holy, Holy, Holy! Though the darkness hide Thee,
 3  Though the eye of sinful man Thy glory may not see,
 3  Only Thou art holy, there is none beside Thee
 3  Perfect in power, in love, and purity.

Hymns, #10
Worship of the Father - As the Eternal One

E10 C7t K7t S5 T10

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Lowell Mason & Clement C. Scholefield
Meter
:
8.8.8.8

Hymns using same tune:
Tune 2: #740, #746, #843
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
 
 1  O God, th' eternal Father, Thou,
 1  The uncreated, great I AM!
 1  More ancient than the ancients are,
 1  Before the primal age began!
 
 2  From everlasting Thou art God,
 2  All time and space Thou dost transcend!
 2  The fulness of eternity,
 2  Without beginning, without end!
 
 3  Th' eternal source of all Thou art,
 3  Before the heavens were decreed!
 3  Thou art the first of all the first,
 3  And e'en the foremost dost precede!
 
 4  Thou art the life that ever lasts,
 4  From age to age Thou endest not!
 4  More lasting than all that which lasts,
 4  Beyond the ultimate Thou art!
 
 5  Thou art the Alpha as the first,
 5  Omega, as the last Thou art!
 5  From start to end Thou hast no lack, Complete
 5  and perfect, wanting not!
 
 6  We praise Thee for Thine endless years,
 6  Extol Thee for Thy boundlessness!
 6  We praise Thee for Thy fulness vast,
 6  Extol Thee for Thy perfectness
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #11
Worship of the Father - As the Spirit

E11 C8 K8 S6 T11

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Henry S. Cutler
Meter
:
8.6.8.6

Hymns using same tune:
#30, #865, #884, #1296
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8 
 
 1  Thou, Father, who art Spirit true,
 1     The holiest of all;
 1  We worship in the spirit now,
 1     In truth upon Thee call.
 
 2  A spirit Thou hast made for us
 2     That we may worship Thee,
 2  That echoing in spirit thus
 2     One spirit we will be.
 
 3  The Father in the Son has come,
 3     The Son the Spirit is,
 3  That to our spirit God may come.
 3     O what a grace is this!
 
 4  The Son is Thine eternal Word,
 4     The Word is Spirit too;
 4  The Spirit as our life has come
 4     Our spirit to renew.
 
 5  Thy Spirit in our spirit is,
 5     And thus in unity
 5  Thy Spirit witnesseth with ours
 5     That we are born of Thee.
 
 6  In everything Thy Spirit leads
 6     That we may follow Him;
 6  We thus may spiritual become,
 6     With life and peace within.
 
 7  In spirit we would worship Thee,
 7     In spirit Thee address,
 7  Until our spirit is released
 7     Thine image to express.
 
 8  Our Father, we would praise Thee now
 8     That Thou the Spirit art;
 8  In spirit and in truth to Thee
 8     True worship we impart.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #12
Worship of the Father - As the Source of Life

E12 C9 K9 S7 T12

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
C. Hutcheson & John B. Dykes
Meter
:
8.6.8.6

Hymns using same tune:
Tune 2: #209, #744
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7 
 
 1  O God, Thou art the source of life,
 1     Divine, and rich and free!
 1  As living water flowing out
 1     Unto eternity!
 
 2  In love Thou in the Son didst flow
 2     Among the human race;
 2  Thou dost as Spirit also flow
 2     Within us thru Thy grace.
 
 3  Though we in sin and wickedness
 3     Went far from Thee apace,
 3  Yet in the Son Thou didst redeem,
 3     Bestowing life and grace.
 
 4  Though we have often slighted Thee,
 4     Thy Spirit often grieved,
 4  Yet Thou dost still as Spirit come
 4     As life to be received.
 
 5  Thou as the Spirit in the Son
 5     Hast mingled heretofore;
 5  Thou wilt thru fellowship anoint.
 5     And increase more and more.
 
 6  The love of God, the grace of Christ,
 6     The Spirit's flowing free,
 6  Enable us God's wealth to share
 6     Thru all eternity.
 
 7  The Father, Son, and Spirit - one,
 7     So richly care for us;
 7  Thy love with one accord we sing
 7     And e'er would praise Thee thus.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #13
Worship of the Father - As Love and Light

E13 C6 K6 S8 T13

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Silas J. Vail
Meter
:
8.7.8.7. with chorus

Hymns using same tune:
#386, #474, #1163
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7 
 
 1  Thou art love and Thou art light, Lord,
 1     In the Son as life Thou art;
 1  Love expressing, light illum'ning,
 1     Thou dost life to us impart.
 
Thou art love! Thou art light!
   In the Son as life Thou art;
Love expressing, light illum'ning
   Thou dost life to us impart.
 
 2  Love bespeaks Thy very being,
 2     What Thou dost is shown by light;
 2  Love is inward, light is outward,
 2     Love accompanies the light.
 
Thou art love! Thou art light!
   In the Son as life Thou art;
Love expressing, light illum'ning
   Thou dost life to us impart.
 
 3  Love by grace is manifested,
 3     And the light by truth is shown;
 3  By Thy love we may enjoy Thee;
 3     By Thy light Thou, Lord, art known.
 
Thou art love! Thou art light!
   In the Son as life Thou art;
Love expressing, light illum'ning
   Thou dost life to us impart.
 
 4  Thru Thy love, which led to Calvary,
 4     We receive the life of God;
 4  Light our understanding opens,
 4     That we may apply the blood.
 
Thou art love! Thou art light!
   In the Son as life Thou art;
Love expressing, light illum'ning
   Thou dost life to us impart.
 
 5  Thru Thy love, as life Thou enter'st
 5     Fellowship with Thee to give;
 5  Thru Thy light we take Thy cleansing
 5     And in fellowship may live.
 
Thou art love! Thou art light!
   In the Son as life Thou art;
Love expressing, light illum'ning
   Thou dost life to us impart.
 
 6  By the light and blood which cleanses,
 6     The anointing we shall know;
 6  Then the life of love Thine essence,
 6     More and more in us will flow.
 
Thou art love! Thou art light!
   In the Son as life Thou art;
Love expressing, light illum'ning
   Thou dost life to us impart.
 
 7  By Thy love we are Thy children,
 7     Abba Father calling Thee;
 7  Light disperses all our darkness,
 7     Till, like Him, Thy Son, we see.
 
O what grace! O what truth!
   Love is seen and light is shown!
We would praise Thee never ceasing,
   Thou by love and light art known!
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7

Hymns, #14
Worship of the Father - His Immortality

E14 C- K- S- T14

Lyrics
:
Walter Chalmers Smith
Music
:
Welsh hymn melody
Meter
:
11.11.11.11

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
 
 1  Immortal, invisible, God only wise,
 1  In light inaccessible hid from our eyes,
 1  Most blessed, most glorious, the Ancient of Days,
 1  Almighty, victorious, Thy great name we praise.
 
 2  Unresting, unhasting, and silent as light,
 2  Nor wanting, nor wasting, Thou rulest in might;
 2  Thy justice like mountains high soaring above,
 2  Thy clouds which are fountains of goodness and love.
 
 3  To all life Thou givest, to both great and small;
 3  In all life Thou livest, the true life of all;
 3  We blossom and flourish as leaves on the tree,
 3  And wither and perish, but nought changeth Thee.
 
 4  Great Father of Glory, pure Father of Light,
 4  Thine angels adore Thee, all veiling their sight;
 4  All laud we would render, O help us to see:
 4  'Tis only the splendor of light hideth Thee.
 
 5  Immortal, invisible, God only wise,
 5  In light inaccessible hid from our eyes,
 5  Most blessed, most glorious, the Ancient of Days,
 5  Almighty, victorious, Thy great name we praise.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #15
Worship of the Father - His Transcendence

E15 C10 K10 S9 T15

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Lowell Mason
Meter
:
7.6.7.6.D

Hymns using same tune:
#915, #941, #1023, #1098, #1099
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
 
 1  O God, Thou art transcendent,
 1     The Holy One Thou art!
 1  None other is Thine equal,
 1     Incomp'rable Thou art!
 1  The holiest of the holy
 1     The universe may call!
 1  Thy power and Thy nature
 1     Do far exceed it all!
 
 2  Distinct, unique, and holy,
 2     Not only right and pure;
 2  Not only without defect,
 2     But with perfection more;
 2  For nothing can approach Thee,
 2     Nor e'er Thine equal be;
 2  If aught Thy place hath taken,
 2     'Tis insult unto Thee.
 
 3  The excellent excelling,
 3     The fairest of the fair,
 3  Yet differing from the finest,
 3     For none with Thee compare.
 3  From all the righteous different,
 3     For Thine is absolute;
 3  None beauteous with Thee vying,
 3     For Thine excels repute.
 
 4  Thy holiness transcendent
 4     Thou hast for us prepared,
 4  And this distinctive nature
 4     We have already shared.
 4  We share in Thy transcendence,
 4     Since we Thy nature own;
 4  Thy holy life we follow
 4     Till unto fulness grown.
 
 5  We give Thee praise and worship
 5     For all Thy holiness,
 5  For Thy transcendent nature,
 5     Thine utter peerlessness.
 5  We praise Thee that Thy nature -
 5     Unique, distinct - we share;
 5  This separating nature
 5     Is ours now and fore'er.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #16
Worship of the Father - His Newness

E16 C11 K11 S10 T16

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
George F. Root
Meter
:
8.6.8.6.D

Hymns using same tune:
#539, #760, #1072
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
 
 1  Our Father, as the evergreen,
 1     Thou art forever new;
 1  Thou art the ever living Lord,
 1     Thy freshness as the dew.
 
O Father, Thou art unchanging,
   Thou never hast grown old;
Thru countless ages, ever fresh,
   Thy newness doth unfold.
 
 2  O Thou art God, and Thou art "new";
 2     Without Thee all is worn,
 2  But all with Thee is ever fresh,
 2     Though many years have gone.
 
O Father, Thou art unchanging,
   Thou never hast grown old;
Thru countless ages, ever fresh,
   Thy newness doth unfold.
 
 3  Each blessing Thou hast given us
 3     Thy newness doth contain;
 3  Thy covenant, Thy ways are new,
 3     And ever thus remain.
 
O Father, Thou art unchanging,
   Thou never hast grown old;
Thru countless ages, ever fresh,
   Thy newness doth unfold.
 
 4  Now we Thy new creation are
 4     New spirit and new heart;
 4  We're daily from the old renewed,
 4     New life Thou dost impart.
 
O Father, Thou art unchanging,
   Thou never hast grown old;
Thru countless ages, ever fresh,
   Thy newness doth unfold.
 
 5  The earth and heavens will be new
 5     And Thy new city share;
 5  New fruits each month will be supplied,
 5     For all is newness there.
 
O Father, Thou art unchanging,
   Thou never hast grown old;
Thru countless ages, ever fresh,
   Thy newness doth unfold.
 
 6  O Father, Thou art ever new,
 6     And all is new in Thee;
 6  We sing the new eternal song,
 6     New praise we give to Thee.
 
O Father, Thou art unchanging,
   Thou never hast grown old;
Thru countless ages, ever fresh,
   Thy newness doth unfold.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6

Hymns, #17
Worship of the Father - His Greatness

E17 C12 K12 S11 T17

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Swedish folk melody, arr. by Mrs. Paul Friedmann
Meter
:
11.10.11.10. with chorus

Hymns using same tune:
#608, #1107, #1110
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  My Father God, when on Thy vast creation.
 1  The wonders of the heav'n and earth, I gaze.
 1  Things great and small, beyond enumeration,
 1  Which manifest Thy pow'r in untold ways;
 
Then all my being sings in praise to Thee,
   How marvelous! How great Thou art!
And this I'll sing through all eternity,
   How marvelous! How great Thou art!
 
 2  As I enjoy the grace of Thy salvation
 2  And contemplate how Thou Thy Son hast sent,
 2  Who died that we might be Thy new creation,
 2  Thy life expressing to the full extent;
 
Then all my being sings in praise to Thee,
   How marvelous! How great Thou art!
And this I'll sing through all eternity,
   How marvelous! How great Thou art!
 
 3  When in the church, in blest participation,
 3  I see how millions Thine own life possess,
 3  How they are built to form Thy habitation,
 3  Containing Thee, Thy fulness to express;
 
Then all my being sings in praise to Thee,
   How marvelous! How great Thou art!
And this I'll sing through all eternity,
   How marvelous! How great Thou art!
 
 4  As I expect the coming age of fulness
 4  And hope to share the new Jerusalem,
 4  With all the heavens and the earth in newness
 4  And all Thou art expressed in all of them;
 
Then all my being sings in praise to Thee,
   How marvelous! How great Thou art!
And this I'll sing through all eternity,
   How marvelous! How great Thou art!
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #18
Worship of the Father - His Faithfulness

E18 C14 K14 S12 T18

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Samuel A. Ward
Meter
:
8.6.8.6.D

Hymns using same tune:
#23, #1182
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8 
 
 1  How faithful and trustworthy too,
 1     My Father God, art Thou;
 1  The universe and all therein
 1     Thy faithfulness avow.
 
How steadfast is Thy faithfulness!
   For this I worship Thee;
It is established in the heav'n,
   And ever stands for me.
 
 2  No turning shadow could there be,
 2     Nor any change with Thee;
 2  As Thou hast been, and now Thou art,
 2     Forever Thou wilt be.
 
How steadfast is Thy faithfulness!
   For this I worship Thee;
It is established in the heav'n,
   And ever stands for me.
 
 3  Thy word, as certain as Thyself,
 3     Can never pass away;
 3  Though heav'n and earth shall disappear,
 3     Thy word abides for aye.
 
How steadfast is Thy faithfulness!
   For this I worship Thee;
It is established in the heav'n,
   And ever stands for me.
 
 4  Thy gifts without repentance are,
 4     Thy calling is the same;
 4  Thy grace forever lasting is,
 4     Thy mercy as Thy name.
 
How steadfast is Thy faithfulness!
   For this I worship Thee;
It is established in the heav'n,
   And ever stands for me.
 
 5  Thy word with Thine own faithfulness
 5     A surety is to me;
 5  By it, with Thy salvation true,
 5     I have the certainty.
 
How steadfast is Thy faithfulness!
   For this I worship Thee;
It is established in the heav'n,
   And ever stands for me.
 
 6  If, due to self, I trust Thee not,
 6     Yet Thou art faithful still;
 6  Thou never canst deny Thyself,
 6     Thy word Thou shalt fulfill.
 
How steadfast is Thy faithfulness!
   For this I worship Thee;
It is established in the heav'n,
   And ever stands for me.
 
 7  As Thou art faithful to perform
 7     Thy promise and Thy call;
 7  So, feeding on Thy faithfulness,
 7     I take Thyself withal.
 
How steadfast is Thy faithfulness!
   For this I worship Thee;
It is established in the heav'n,
   And ever stands for me.
 
 8  The rainbow round about Thy throne
 8     Thy faithfulness declares;
 8  This attribute forevermore
 8     The holy city bears.
 
How steadfast is Thy faithfulness!
   For this I worship Thee;
It is established in the heav'n,
   And ever stands for me.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #19
Worship of the Father - His Faithfulness

E19 C13 K13 S- T19

Lyrics
:
Thomas O. Chisholm
Music
:
William M. Runyan
Meter
:
11.10.11.10. with chorus

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3 
 
 1  "Great is Thy faithfulness," O God my Father,
 1  There is no shadow of turning with Thee;
 1  Thou changest not, Thy compassions, they fail not;
 1  As Thou hast been Thou forever wilt be.
 
"Great is Thy faithfulness!" "Great is Thy faithfulness!"
   Morning by morning new mercies I see;
All I have needed Thy hand hath provided -
   "Great is Thy faithfulness," Lord, unto me!
 
 2  Summer and winter, and springtime and harvest,
 2  Sun, moon and stars in their courses above,
 2  Join with all nature in manifold witness
 2  To Thy great faithfulness, mercy and love.
 
"Great is Thy faithfulness!" "Great is Thy faithfulness!"
   Morning by morning new mercies I see;
All I have needed Thy hand hath provided -
   "Great is Thy faithfulness," Lord, unto me!
 
 3  Pardon for sin and a peace that endureth,
 3  Thy own dear presence to cheer and to guide;
 3  Strength for today and bright hope for tomorrow,
 3  Blessings all mine, with ten thousand beside!
 
"Great is Thy faithfulness!" "Great is Thy faithfulness!"
   Morning by morning new mercies I see;
All I have needed Thy hand hath provided -
   "Great is Thy faithfulness," Lord, unto me!
 
Verses:  1   2   3 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #20
Worship of the Father - His Righteousness

E20 C18 K18 S13 T20

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Franz Joseph Haydn
Meter
:
8.7.8.7.D

Hymns using same tune:
#43, #977, #1183, #1203, #1263, #1275
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  God our Father, we adore Thee,
 1     For the sake of righteousness;
 1  Thou in Christ hast justified us,
 1     Who our conscience can depress?
 1  Thou art righteous, and art faithful,
 1     On Thy righteousness we stand;
 1  No unrighteousness is in Thee,
 1     None can turn Thy righteous hand.
 
 2  Thou hast laid our sins on Jesus,
 2     By Thy justice He was killed;
 2  All Thy holy law's requirements
 2     For Thy justice He fulfilled.
 2  Recompense from Him receiving,
 2     Thou art fully satisfied;
 2  How couldst Thou, O God most righteous,
 2     Claim it once more from our side?
 
 3  Father God, Thou hast accepted
 3     Jesus as our Substitute;
 3  Judged the Just One for the unjust,
 3     Couldst Thou change Thy attitude?
 3  As a proof of perfect justice,
 3     At Thine own right hand He sits;
 3  He, as Thy full satisfaction,
 3     Righteously Thy need befits.
 
 4  Father, through the blood of Jesus
 4     We possess Thy righteousness;
 4  By Thy righteousness protected,
 4     None can shake our steadfastness.
 4  Righteousness of Thine Thou mad'st us,
 4     None can ever us condemn;
 4  We'll forever testify this
 4     In the new Jerusalem.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #21
Worship of the Father - His Righteousness

E21 C16 K16 S14 T21

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
S. Chandler
Meter
:
8.8.6.8.8.6

Hymns using same tune:
#471, #1003
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
 
 1  We praise Thee for Thy righteousness;
 1  Thy justice, Father, we confess,
 1     And fully testify.
 1  Thou art the judge of all mankind,
 1  In Thee injustice none can find,
 1     Nor wrong to Thee apply.
 
 2  O holy Father, righteous One,
 2  Thy righteousness upholds Thy throne,
 2     'Tis a foundation sure.
 2  'Tis through this righteousness of Thine
 2  That reigns in Christ the grace divine,
 2     And peace we thus secure.
 
 3  Thy righteousness has caused Thy Son
 3  To die for us that we be won,
 3     Redemption thus was bought;
 3  Thy righteousness has justified
 3  When Christ's redemption was applied,
 3     Salvation thus was wrought.
 
 4  That Thou might show Thy righteousness,
 4  With Thy forgiveness Thou didst bless
 4     Men in the ancient age;
 4  For Thee Thy righteousness to show,
 4  Remission Thou dost now bestow
 4     On sinners in this age.
 
 5  All people Thou wilt judge one day,
 5  Thy righteousness to all display
 5     By Christ, Thy Son, our Lord;
 5  Yet fast we'll stand, for none can move,
 5  Thy righteousness we'll ever prove,
 5     With grace Thou wilt afford.
 
 6  With justice is Thy kingdom filled,
 6  And peace upon it Thou dost build
 6     With all in harmony;
 6  In the new heaven and new earth
 6  Thy righteousness will be their worth,
 6     As promised, God, by Thee.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #22
Worship of the Father - His Holiness

E22 C19 K19 S15 T22

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
John B. Dykes
Meter
:
8.7.8.7

Hymns using same tune:
#90, #170
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
 
 1  Holy Father, we adore Thee,
 1     Rev'rent song to Thee we raise;
 1  Thou art holy, Thou art lofty,
 1     "Holy is Thy Name," we praise.
 
 2  Loving is Thy heart, dear Father,
 2     Righteous ever are Thy ways;
 2  But how holy is Thy nature,
 2     Yet, to us Christ it conveys.
 
 3  Thou hast ever sanctified us
 3     With the blood of Christ our Lord;
 3  Thou hast separated sinners
 3     Thru the truth which is Thy Word.
 
 4  Thou hast, by Thy Holy Spirit,
 4     Made us holy unto Thee;
 4  And our spirit, soul, and body
 4     Wholly sanctified will be.
 
 5  Oh! The holy life of Jesus
 5     Thru Thy grace we now possess;
 5  Thou wilt make us e'en partakers
 5     Of Thy very holiness.
 
 6  When within that holy city,
 6     Thy full holiness we'll share,
 6  To the uttermost forever,
 6     "Thou art holy," we'll declare.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6

Hymns, #23
Worship of the Father - His Wisdom

E23 C20 K20 S16 T23

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Samuel A. Ward
Meter
:
8.6.8.6.D

Hymns using same tune:
#18, #1182
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
 
 1  In all Thy wisdom, Father God,
 1     According to Thy will,
 1  Eternal purpose Thou hast made
 1     That all Thy Son might fill.
 
How deep and rich Thy wisdom is,
   O who can search and trace?
Yet, Father God, in it we find
   Thy mercy and Thy grace!
 
 2  How wondrously Thou mad'st all things,
 2     O who can know Thy mind?
 2  All are of Thee, thru Thee, to Thee,
 2     Thy wisdom here we find.
 
How deep and rich Thy wisdom is,
   O who can search and trace?
Yet, Father God, in it we find
   Thy mercy and Thy grace!
 
 3  Thy wisdom shuts up all in sin,
 3     That mercy may be shown,
 3  That none may boast in anything
 3     But in Thyself alone.
 
How deep and rich Thy wisdom is,
   O who can search and trace?
Yet, Father God, in it we find
   Thy mercy and Thy grace!
 
 4  In wisdom, by the cross, Thou hast
 4     For us redemption made,
 4  That in our spirit we may have
 4     Thyself, the treasure, laid.
 
How deep and rich Thy wisdom is,
   O who can search and trace?
Yet, Father God, in it we find
   Thy mercy and Thy grace!
 
 5  Thy wisdom thru Thy Church is known
 5     By principalities,
 5  Thru us Thy wisdom manifold
 5     Shown in the heavenlies.
 
How deep and rich Thy wisdom is,
   O who can search and trace?
Yet, Father God, in it we find
   Thy mercy and Thy grace!
 
 6  When in the new Jerusalem
 6     In mercy we will boast,
 6  Thy wisdom will be known for aye
 6     Unto the uttermost.
 
How deep and rich Thy wisdom is,
   O who can search and trace?
Yet, Father God, in it we find
   Thy mercy and Thy grace!
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next

Meter
:

Hymn using same tune:

*Repeat the last two lines of each verse
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
 
 
 1  O God, in Christ all focused is
 1     Thy wisdom with Thy grace;
 1  As wisdom Thou mad'st Him to us,
 1     In Him Thy way we trace.
 
 2  What Thou has planned is all in Him,
 2     Thy way of grace is He;
 2  In Him, Thy Wisdom, we have all,
 2     That glory be to Thee.
 
 3  In Him, who is our righteousness,
 3     Have we been justified;
 3  In Him, who is our holiness,
 3     We're being sanctified.
 
 4  Redemption too He is to us,
 4     According to Thy plan,
 4  That we may fully be redeemed
 4     To be a perfect man.
 
 5  He is Thy wisdom, Father God,
 5     In Thine economy;
 5  For Him we offer praise to Thee
 5     With all humility.
 
 6  Thy wisdom we have seen in Him,
 6     So rich and so profound;
 6  Yet richer, deeper, in Thy way,
 6     By us will it be found.

Hymns, #25
Worship of the Father - His Mercy

Lyrics
:

Music
:
John B. Dykes
Meter
:
10.4.10.4.10.10

Hymn using same tune:
#52
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3 
 
 1  Father, to us Thy mercy Thou hast shown,
 1        In Thine own way;
 1  Sinners like us as dear sons Thou wouldst own,
 1        In love for aye.
 1  Vessels of mercy, Thou didst us prepare;
 1  Vessels of honor, we Thyself declare.
 
 2  "In mercy I delight, not sacrifice,"
 2        Thou hast declared;
 2  Thru this Thy mercy, favor in Thine eyes
 2        We all have shared.
 2  'Tis not of them that will nor them that run,
 2  But of Thee showing mercy as was done.
 
 3  Father, Thy mercy with Thy love and grace
 3        Did we obtain;
 3  And in Thy mercy, with Thee face to face,
 3        We'll e'er remain;
 3  And for Thy mercy we would worship Thee
 3  Through all our days and through eternity.

Hymns, #26
Worship of the Father - His Mercy

E26 C22 K22 S18 T26

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Philip P. Bliss
Meter
:
8.7.8.7.8.7

Hymn using same tune:
#34
*Repeat the last line of each verse
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
 
 
 1  God, we praise Thee for Thy mercy,
 1     'Tis so great and so profound!
 1  In our weakness and our failures;
 1     With its greatness it abounds.
 1  We adore Thee! We adore Thee!
 1     With such mercy we've been crowned!
 
 2  How we marvel at this mercy
 2     So far-reaching and so vast!
 2  It has reached us, e'en the sinners,
 2     And will ever hold us fast.
 2  From this mercy, from this mercy,
 2     What can cause us to be cast?
 
 3  For Thy mercy we are grateful,
 3     'Tis so rich, so plenteous!
 3  Thru Thy mercy in redemption,
 3     Thou hast richly favored us.
 3  If without this, if without this,
 3     How could we be favored thus?
 
 4  Oh, Thy mercy, so inspiring!
 4     Gentle, tender, dear and sweet!
 4  With Thy patience and Thy kindness,
 4     Us in all our need it meets.
 4  It we treasure, it we treasure,
 4     Nothing can with it compete.
 
 5  Father, we enjoy Thy mercy,
 5     Ever fresh and ever new;
 5  Every morning shed upon us,
 5     It refreshes as the dew.
 5  How we taste it! How we taste it!
 5     Giving Thee the praises due.
 
 6  We can never cease to praise Thee,
 6     As Thy mercy e'er endures;
 6  All Thy grace and all Thy favor,
 6     Ever for us it secures.
 6  Trusting in it, trusting in it,
 6     Thy sure mercy us assures.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6

Hymns, #27
Worship of the Father - His Love

E27 C- K1021 S- T27

Lyrics
:
Howard Kingsbury
Music
:
Unknown
Meter
:
8.6.8.6.8.8.8.6

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3 
 
 1  Come, let us all unite to sing,
 1     God is love, God is love.
 1  Let heav'n and earth their praises bring;
 1     God is love, God is love.
 1  Let ev'ry soul from sin awake,
 1  Each in his heart sweet music make,
 1  And sing with us, for Jesus' sake,
 1     God is love! God is love!
 
 2  How happy is our portion here!
 2     God is love, God is love.
 2  His promises our spirits cheer;
 2     God is love, God is love.
 2  He is our sun and shield by day,
 2  Our help, our hope, our strength, and stay,
 2  He will be with us all the way:
 2     God is love! God is love!
 
 3  In glory we shall sing again,
 3     God is love, God is love.
 3  Yes, this shall be our lofty strain,
 3     God is love, God is love.
 3  While endless ages roll along,
 3  In concert with the heav'nly throng,
 3  This shall be still our sweetest song,
 3     God is love! God is love!
 
Verses:  1   2   3

Hymns, #28
Worship of the Father - His Love

E28 C24 K24 S19 T28

Lyrics
:
F. M. Lehman
Music
:
F. M. Lehman
Meter
:
Peculiar Meter

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3 
 
 1  The love of God is greater far
 1     Than tongue or pen can ever tell
 1  It goes beyond the highest star
 1     And reaches to the lowest hell.
 1  The guilty pair, bowed down with care,
 1     God gave His Son to win;
 1  His erring child He reconciled
 1     And pardoned from his sin.
 
O love of God, how rich and pure!
   How measureless and strong!
It shall forevermore endure
   The saints' and angels' song.
 
 2  When hoary time shall pass away,
 2     And earthly kingdoms fall;
 2  When men who here refuse to pray,
 2     On rocks and hills and mountains call;
 2  God's love, so sure, shall still endure,
 2     All measureless and strong;
 2  Redeeming grace to Adam's race -
 2     The saints' and angels' song.
 
O love of God, how rich and pure!
   How measureless and strong!
It shall forevermore endure
   The saints' and angels' song.
 
 3  Could we with ink the ocean fill,
 3     And were the skies of parchment made;
 3  Were every stalk on earth a quill,
 3     And every man a scribe by trade;
 3  To write the love of God above
 3     Would drain the ocean dry;
 3  Nor could the scroll contain the whole,
 3     Though stretched from sky to sky.
 
O love of God, how rich and pure!
   How measureless and strong!
It shall forevermore endure
   The saints' and angels' song.
 
Verses:  1   2   3 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #29
Worship of the Father - His Love

E29 C27 K27 S20 T29

Lyrics
:
Ann Taylor Gilbert
Music
:
Unknown
Meter
:
6.6.6.6.8.8

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  What was it, blessed God,
 1  Led Thee to give Thy Son,
 1  To yield Thy Well-beloved
 1  For us by sin undone?
 1  'Twas love unbounded led Thee thus,
 1  To give Thy Well-beloved for us.
 
 2  What led Thy Son, O God,
 2  To leave Thy throne on high,
 2  To shed His precious blood,
 2  To suffer and to die?
 2  'Twas love - unbounded love to us
 2  Led Him to die and suffer thus.
 
 3  What moved Thee to impart
 3  Thy Spirit from above,
 3  Therewith to fill our heart
 3  With heavenly peace and love?
 3  'Twas love - unbounded love to us
 3  Moved Thee to give Thy Spirit thus.
 
 4  What love to Thee we owe,
 4  Our God, for all Thy grace!
 4  Our hearts may well o'erflow
 4  In everlasting praise!
 4  Make us, O God, to praise Thee thus
 4  For all Thy boundless love to us.

Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8 
 
 1  What love Thou hast bestowed on us,
 1     We thank Thee from our heart;
 1  Our Father, we would worship Thee
 1     And praise for all Thou art.
 
 2  Thy heart Thou hast revealed to us,
 2     Made known th' eternal will;
 2  Within the Son Thou hast come forth,
 2     Thy purpose to fulfill.
 
 3  Thou gavest Thy beloved Son
 3     In love to come and die,
 3  That we may be Thy many sons,
 3     As heirs with Him, made nigh.
 
 4  Through Him we have Thy very life
 4     And Thou our Father art;
 4  Thy very nature, all Thyself,
 4     Thou dost to us impart.
 
 5  Thy Spirit into ours has come
 5     That we may "Abba" cry;
 5  Of Spirit born, with Spirit sealed,
 5     To be transformed thereby.
 
 6  The many sons to glory brought
 6     Is Thine eternal goal,
 6  And to Thy Son's own image wrought,
 6     Thou wilt conform the whole.
 
 7  Throughout Thy transformation work
 7     Thou dost direct each one,
 7  From glory unto glory bring
 7     Until the work is done.
 
 8  What love Thou, Father, hast bestowed;
 8     We'll ever grateful be;
 8  We'll worship Thee forevermore
 8     And praise unceasingly.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8

Hymns, #31
Worship of the Father - His Love

E31 C29 K29 S- T-

Lyrics
:
Horatius Bonar
Music
:
Isaac Smith
Meter
:
8.6.8.6

Hymns using same tune:
#220 (Tune 2), #410
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8   9 
 
 1  All that we were - our sin, our guilt,
 1     Our death - was all our own:
 1  All that we are we owe to Thee,
 1     Thou God of grace alone.
 
 2  Thy mercy found us in our sins,
 2     And gave us to believe;
 2  Then, in believing, peace we found,
 2     And in Thy Christ we live.
 
 3  All that we are, as saints on earth,
 3     All that we hope to be,
 3  When Jesus comes and glory dawns,
 3     We owe it all to Thee.
 
 4  O God, how rich, how vast Thy love,
 4     Whoe'er can Thee repay?
 4  Thy love is past man's finding out,
 4     Thy grace no man can say.
 
 5  But Lord, to me I pray Thee grant,
 5     More clearly may I see,
 5  That I may e'er more fully know
 5     How much I owe to Thee.
 
 6  But if man's heart should e'er suppose
 6     He could repay Thy love,
 6  It only means he nothing knows
 6     Of love, all loves above.
 
 7  So may we never bargains make
 7     With that dear love of Thine:
 7  The love that made Thine heart once break,
 7     Whoe'er that love could win?
 
 8  Then nevermore suggest return,
 8     His love is far too high;
 8  But let our hearts with rapture burn
 8     That He for us should die.
 
 9  O Father God, we owe Thee all!
 9     All that we are and have!
 9  With grateful thanks before Thee fall,
 9     'Tis all that we can give.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8   9

Lyrics

Music

:

Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8   9 
 
 1  We bow and worship, Father, here
 1  And marvel at Thy wondrous love.
 1  O what is man that Thou shouldst deign
 1  To him such boundless grace to prove!
 
 2  We praise Thee for Thy heart's intent
 2  That man Thy likeness should Possess,
 2  That with Thy life and nature filled
 2  Thine image he should manifest.
 
 3  Man in Thine image Thou didst make,
 3  To him authority didst give;
 3  Thyself presenting as his life,
 3  That by Thy riches he might live.
 
 4  To enter man Thou dost desire,
 4  With him to mingle thru Thy grace,
 4  That man may be transformed and built
 4  To be Thy worthy dwelling place.
 
 5  Tho' man did fall, Thou didst not leave
 5  Thy heart's intent, but Thou didst move;
 5  Redeeming man to bring him back,
 5  Thou didst Thy love and wisdom prove.
 
 6  In Christ Thou didst Thyself reveal,
 6  Who died and rose, redemption wrought;
 6  In Spirit Thou hast entered man
 6  And to him life and grace hast brought.
 
 7  My spirit is Thy holiest place,
 7  Thy throne of grace is founded there;
 7  Thou wouldst that we in spirit come
 7  To burn the incense thru our prayer.
 
 8  Such grace is like a river full
 8  Which from the throne of grace doth come;
 8  It floweth thru, transforming us,
 8  And builds us up to be Thy home.
 
 9  Receiving of Thy matchless grace,
 9  We marvel at Thy gift so free;
 9  With grateful hearts for Thy great love,
 9  In spirit now we worship Thee.

 1     Who all Thy will hath done;
 1  And by the one chief treasure
 1     Thy bosom freely gave,
 1  Thine own pure love we measure,
 1     Thy willing mind to save.
 
 2  O God of mercy - Father!
 2     The one unchanging claim,

 2     From Christ's most precious name:
 2  What always sounds so sweetly
 2     In Thine unwearied ear,
 2  Has freed our souls completely
 2     From all our guilt and fear.
 
 3  The trembling sinner feareth
 3     That God can ne'er forget;
 3  But one full payment cleareth
 3     His memory of all debt.
 3  When nought beside could free us,
 3     Or set our souls at large,
 3  The death of God's Beloved
 3     Secured a full discharge.
 
 4  No wrath God's heart retaineth
 4     To usward who believe;
 4  No dread in ours remaineth
 4     As we His love receive;
 4  Returning sons He kisses,
 4     And with His robe invests;
 4  His perfect love dismisses
 4     All terror from our breasts.

Hymns, #43
Worship of the Father - His Redemption

E43 C37 K37 S28 T43

Lyrics
:
James G. Deck
Music
:
Franz Joseph Haydn
Meter
:
8.7.8.7.D

Hymns using same tune:
#20, #977, #1183, #1203, #1263, #1275
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  "Abba, Father," we approach Thee
 1     In our Savior's precious name.
 1  We, Thy children, here assembling,
 1     Now the promised blessing claim.
 1  From our guilt His blood has washed us,
 1     'Tis through Him our souls draw nigh,
 1  And Thy Spirit too has taught us
 1     "Abba, Father," thus to cry.
 
 2  Once as prodigals we wandered,
 2     In our folly, far from Thee;
 2  But Thy grace, o'er sin abounding,
 2     Rescued us from misery.
 2  Clothed in garments of salvation
 2     At Thy table is our place;
 2  We rejoice, and Thou rejoicest,
 2     In the riches of Thy grace.
 
 3  Thou the prodigal hast pardoned,
 3     "Kissed us" with a Father's love;
 3  "Killed the fatted calf," and made us
 3     Fit Thy purpose to approve
 3  "It is meet," we hear Thee saying,
 3     "We should merry be and glad;
 3  I have found My once-lost children,
 3     Now they live who once were dead."
 
 4  "Abba, Father," we adore Thee,
 4     While the hosts in heaven above
 4  E'en in us now learn the wonders
 4     Of Thy wisdom, grace, and love.
 4  Soon before Thy throne assembled,
 4     All Thy children shall proclaim
 4  Abba's love shown in redemption,
 4     And how full is Abba's name!
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4

Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  O Holy Father, who in tender love
 1     Didst give Thine only Son for us to die,
 1  The while He pleads at Thy right hand above,
 1     We in one Spirit now with faith draw nigh;
 1  And, as we eat this bread and drink this wine,
 1     Plead His once offered sacrifice Divine.
 
 2  We are not worthy to be called Thy sons,
 2     Nor gather up the fragments of Thy feast;
 2  Yet look on us, Thy sorrowing contrite ones,
 2     On us in Him our Advocate and Priest,
 2  Whose robe is fringed with mercy's golden bells,
 2     Whose breastplate fathomless compassion tells.
 
 3  Oh, hear us, for Thou always hearest Him;
 3     Behold us sprinkled with His precious blood;
 3  And from between the shadowing cherubim
 3     Shine forth, and grant us by this heav'nly food
 3  Foretastes of coming glory, and meanwhile
 3     A Father's blessing and a Father's smile.
 
 4  And, Father, ere we leave Thy mercy-throne,
 4     Bound by these sacred pledges, yet most free,
 4  We give our hearts, and not our hearts alone,
 4     But all we are and all we have to Thee;
 4  Glad free-will offerings all our pilgrim days,
 4     Hereafter an eternity of praise.

Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  Abba, Father! We adore Thee,
 1     Humbly now our homage pay;
 1  'Tis Thy children's bliss to know Thee,
 1     None but children "Abba" say.
 1  This high honor we inherit,
 1     Thy free gift through Jesus' blood;
 1  God the Spirit, with our spirit,
 1     Witnesseth we're sons of God.
 
 2  Thine own purpose gave us being'
 2     When in Christ, in that vast plan,
 2  Thou in Christ didst choose Thy people
 2     E'en before the world began.
 2  Oh, what love Thou, Father, bore us!
 2     Oh, how precious in Thy sight!
 2  When to Thine own Son Thou gav'st us,
 2     To Thy Son, Thy soul's delight.
 
 3  Though our nature's fall in Adam
 3     Shut us wholly out from God,
 3  Thine eternal counsel brought us
 3     Nearer still, through Jesus' blood;
 3  For in Him we found redemption,
 3     Grace and glory in Thy Son;
 3  O the height and depth of mercy!
 3     Christ and His redeemed are one.
 
 4  Hence, through all the changing seasons,
 4     Trouble, sickness, sorrow, woe,
 4  Nothing changeth Thine affections,
 4     Love divine shall bring us through;
 4  Soon shall all Thy blood-bought children
 4     Round the throne their anthems raise,
 4  And, in songs of rich salvation,
 4     Shout to Thine eternal praise.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4

 6     In that blest name of love,

 6     Thy perfect will to prove.

Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  Of the Father's love begotten,
 1     Ere the worlds began to be,
 1  He is Alpha and Omega,
 1     He the source, the ending He,
 1  Of the things that are and have been,
 1     And that future years shall see,
 1        Evermore and evermore.

 2     Chanted of with one accord,
 2  Whom the voices of the prophets
 2     Promised in their faithful word;
 2  Now He shines, the long-expected;
 2     Let creation praise its Lord,
 2        Evermore and evermore.
 
 3  O ye heights of heav'n, adore Him;
 3     Angel hosts, His praises sing;
 3  All dominions, bow before Him,
 3     And extol our Lord and King.
 3  Let no tongue on earth be silent,
 3     Every voice in concert ring,
 3        Evermore and evermore.

 4     And, with Holy Ghost, to Thee,

Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7 
 
 1  O Lord, Thou art the Son of man,
 1  Our human nature Thou didst take;
 1  Begotten of a virgin true,
 1  Of flesh and blood Thou didst partake.
 
 2  In bondman's form, with lowliness,
 2  Thou walkedst on this earth of woe;
 2  The human living Thou didst have
 2  And all its suff'rings undergo.
 
 3  Born in a manger as a babe,
 3  Thou wast a child among the poor;
 3  Thou as a carpenter didst work,
 3  And e'en an outlaw's death endure.
 
 4  Then Thou wast raised up from the dead,
 4  Still with the human nature true;
 4  And as a man in form divine,
 4  Thou didst ascend to heaven too.
 
 5  Now over all, and on the throne,
 5  Thou, still a man, art glorified;
 5  A man with God in light divine
 5  With whom our God is satisfied.
 
 6  In glory Thou wilt come again,
 6  Still as a man appearing then;
 6  As King of kings, with pow'r divine,
 6  With human nature seen by men.
 
 7  Thou, as the center of all things,
 7  In the new heav'n and earth shalt be,
 7  Forever as the One divine,
 7  Existing in humanity.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7

 6     To suffer and to die.

 7     And in the depth be praise:

 5     In the lowly pilgrim's song;

 5     Of the bright angelic throng.
 
 6  Earth to Him her face upraises,
 6     Knows Him as the great I AM!
 6  Heaven resounds with Jesus' praises,
 6     Glory to the bleeding Lamb!

 2     All the hosts of light,
 2  Thrones and dominations,
 2     Stars upon their way,
 2  All the heav'nly orders,
 2     In their great array.

 3     To receive a Name
 3  From the lips of sinners
 3     Unto whom He came,
 3  Faithfully He bore it
 3     Spotless to the last,
 3  Brought it back victorious,
 3     When from death He passed;

 4     With its human light,
 4  Through all ranks of creatures,
 4     To the central height;
 4  To the throne of Godhead,
 4     To the Father's breast,
 4  Filled it with the glory
 4     Of that perfect rest.

 5     With love strong as death,
 5  But with awe and wonder,
 5     And with bated breath;
 5  He is God the Savior,
 5     He is Christ the Lord,
 5  Ever to be worshiped,
 5     Trusted, and adored.
 
 6  In your hearts enthrone Him;
 6     There let Him subdue
 6  All that is not holy,
 6     All that is not true;
 6  Crown Him as your Captain
 6     In temptation's hour;
 6  Let His will enfold you
 6     In its light and power.
 
 7  Brothers, this Lord Jesus
 7     Shall return again,
 7  With His Father's glory,
 7     With His angel train;
 7  For all wreaths of empire
 7     Meet upon His brow,
 7  And our hearts confess Him
 7     King of glory now.

 3        Face to face see Him.

 8  Thou the conqu'ror in hell's hour;
 8  Thou dost us with might empower
 8        Over all to reign.

 9  Thou Thyself art, and didst die, Lord,
 9  All our want to satisfy, Lord;
 9        Now we feast on Thee.
 
 10  Thou the Shepherd and Physician,
 10  Thou hast healed our sick condition;
 10  Comfort, guide, protect - Thy mission;
 10        Thou dost care for us.
 
 11  Priest and King Thou art fore'er, Lord;
 11  Into God we're brought, and there, Lord,
 11  Thine authority we share, Lord;
 11        What an honored place!
 
 12  Thou our Hope and our Redemption,
 12  Thou wilt change our old creation,
 12  Make of Thee a duplication,
 12        Thus Thyself express.
 
 13  Thou our Joy, our Peace, our Glory;
 13  Truth, and Grace, the Rock, the Life-tree,
 13  Building, Mountain, Sun, and Shield - we
 13        Ne'er can tell it all.

 14  Full and perfect, rich, exhaustless -
 14  Meets our need to utter fullness
 14        And from us o'erflows.

 1  For Thou th' eternal Father art,
 1  The uncreated, great I AM!
 
 2  Although a man with men become,
 2  Yet Thou with God eternal art!
 2  The same completeness Thou dost share,
 2  And infinite as God Thou art!
 
 3  Thine origin, the same as God,
 3  Before creation was decreed!

 4  Thy years are to eternity!

 6  Extol Thee for Thy perfectness!

 2  Under the tent of flesh to stay,

 4  Willing to suffer all Thou art,
 4  To God and man complaining not;
 4     Lord, I remember Thee!

 5  Balanced in every way, complete,
 5  Meal-offering to the Father meet;

 6  Never accepting Satan's lies,
 6  None like Thyself, so faithful, wise;

 8  Given Thee glory, majesty,
 8  Heaven and earth will bow the knee;

 1     Which Thou on earth hast trod,
 1  To men Thy wondrous love and grace,
 1     Thy faithfulness to God;
 
 2  Thy love, by man so sorely tried,
 2     Proved stronger than the grave;
 2  The very spear that pierced
 2     Thy side Drew forth the blood to save;

 4     'Mid darkness only light,
 4  Thou didst Thy Father's name confess,
 4     And in His will delight;

 5     Or, suffering, shame, and loss,
 5  Thy path, uncheered by earthly smiles,
 5     Led only to the cross.
 
 6  We wonder at Thy lowly mind,
 6     And fain would like Thee be,
 6  And all our rest and pleasure find
 6     In learning, Lord, of Thee.

 3  So glorious in humility?

 4  Was pang, and scoff, and scorn to Thee;
 4  Yet love through all Thy torture glowed,
 4  And mercy with Thy life-blood flowed.
 
 5  O wondrous Lord, my soul would be
 5  Still more and more conformed to Thee,
 5  And learn of Thee, the lowly One,
 5  And like Thee, all my journey run.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5

 1  Pow'r and praise to Thee belong;
 1  We would all Thy grace record,
 1  Holy, gracious, loving Lord!
 
 2  Rich in glory, Thou didst stoop,
 2  Thence is all Thy people's hope;
 2  Thou wast poor, that we might be
 2  Rich in glory, Lord, with Thee.
 
 3  Wherefore Thou high heaven didst spurn?
 3  Wherefore Thou to earth didst turn?
 3  Why leave heav'n to come to earth
 3  Lonely, scorned, e'en suffering death?
 
 4  Thou in heav'n - the glorious One!
 4  Thou on earth - the outcast Man!
 4  Though this suffering Thou didst know,
 4  Love would come to bear our woe.

 5  Joy and shame our hearts possess;
 5  Joy, that Thou couldst pity thus;
 5  Shame, for such returns from us.

 6  When from every hindrance free,
 6  When to Thee, in glory, brought,
 6  We shall serve Thee as we ought.
 
 7  Now, O Lord, we wait for Thee,
 7  Wait "the blessed hope" to see.
 7  May we ever for Thee live,
 7  Till Thy saints Thou dost receive.

 4     Nor leave Him thus alone.
 
Alone, alone,

He gave Himself to save His own,
He suffered, bled and died alone, alone.

 1  That such sharp sentence should on Thee be spoken?
 1  Of what misdeed hast Thou to make confession -
 1              What dark transgression?
 
 2  They crown Thy head with thorns, they smite, they scourge Thee;
 2  With cruel mockings to the cross they urge Thee;
 2  They give Thee gall to drink, they still decry Thee;

 3  The shepherd dies for sheep that loved to wander;
 3  The Master pays the debt His servants owe Him,
 3              Who would not know Him.

 4  The sinful child of man may live in gladness;
 4  Man forfeited His life and is acquitted -
 4              God is committed.
 
 5  O mighty King, no time can dim Thy glory!
 5  How shall I spread abroad Thy wondrous story?
 5  How shall I find some worthy gift to proffer?
 5              What dare I offer?
 
 6  I'll think upon Thy mercy without ceasing;
 6  That earth's vain joys no more to me be pleasing;
 6  To do Thy will shall be my sole endeavor
 6              Henceforth forever.

 1  O Christ, what burdens bow'd Thy head!
 1     Our load was laid on Thee;
 1  Thou stoodest in the sinner's stead,
 1     Didst bear all ill for me.
 1  A victim led; Thy blood was shed;
 1     Now there's no load for me.
 
 2  Death and the curse were in our cup,
 2     O Christ, 'twas full for Thee!
 2  But Thou hast drained the last dark drop -
 2     'Tis empty now for me.
 2  That bitter cup - love drank it up;
 2     Now blessings' draught for me.
 
 3  Jehovah lifted up His rod,
 3     O Christ, it fell on Thee!
 3  Thou wast sore stricken of Thy God;
 3     There's not one stroke for me.
 3  Thy tears, Thy blood, beneath it flowed;
 3     Thy bruising healeth me.
 
 4  The tempest's awful voice was heard,
 4     O Christ, it broke on Thee!
 4  Thy open bosom was my ward,
 4     It braved the storm for me.
 4  Thy form was scarred, Thy visage marred;
 4     Now cloudless peace for me.
 
 5  Jehovah bade His sword awake,
 5     O Christ, it woke 'gainst Thee!
 5  Thy blood the flaming blade must slake;
 5     Thy heart its sheath must be -
 5  All for my sake, my peace to make;
 5     Now sleeps that sword for me.
 
 6  For me, Lord Jesus, Thou hast died,
 6     And I have died in Thee;
 6  Thou'rt ris'n: my bands are all untied,
 6     And now Thou liv'st in me.
 6  When purified, made white, and tried,
 6     Thy glory then for me!

 1        That for my sake

 1        Frail flesh, and die?

 4        That He His foes
 4        From thence might free.

 5     My Lord on earth might have;
 5  In death, no friendly tomb,
 5     But what a stranger gave.
 5        What may I say?
 5        Heav'n was His home;
 5        But mine the tomb
 5        Wherein He lay.
 
 6  Here might I stay and sing,
 6     No story so divine;
 6  Never was love, dear King,
 6     Never was grief like Thine.
 6        This is my Friend,
 6        In whose sweet praise
 6        I all my days
 6        Could gladly spend.

 1  Thy sorrows, Savior, we retrace,
 1  And tears of praise Thy griefs compel.
 1  What love and grace illume Thy face
 1  As Jesus, as Immanuel!
 
 2  Amid Thy loneliness below,
 2  What scorn and outrage Thee befell:
 2  Deep shame and woe, rude blow on blow,
 2  Endured for us, Immanuel!
 
 3  But oh, what grief, what agony,
 3  When wrathful judgment's awful spell
 3  Burst over Thee on Calv'ry's tree,
 3  God's Lamb for us, Immanuel!
 
 4  Arisen radiant from the dead,
 4  Thy sorrow's scars forever tell,
 4  Creation's Head is He who bled -
 4  Still Jesus, still Immanuel!
 
 5  E'en now from saints, in concord sweet,
 5  Celestial strains of worship well;
 5  For, O, 'tis meet glad songs should greet
 5  Thy heart of love, Immanuel!
 
 6  But when Thy glorious face we see,
 6  How shall the bursting paean swell!
 6  Our souls shall be outpoured for Thee -
 6  Outpoured for Thee, Immanuel!

Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
 
 1  When we survey the wondrous cross
 1  On which the Lord of glory died,
 1  Our richest gain we count but loss,
 1  And pour contempt on all our pride.
 
 2  Our God forbid that we should boast,
 2  Save in the death of Christ, our Lord;
 2  All the vain things that charm us most,
 2  We'd sacrifice them to His blood.
 
 3  There from His head, His hands, His feet,
 3  Sorrow and love flowed mingled down;
 3  Did e'er such love and sorrow meet,
 3  Or thorns compose so rich a crown?
 
 4  His dying crimson, from His head
 4  Spreads o'er His body on the tree;
 4  To all the world then am I dead,
 4  And all the world is dead to me.
 
 5  Were the whole realm of nature ours,
 5  That were an offering far too small;
 5  Love that transcends our highest pow'rs,
 5  Demands our heart, our life, our all.

 2  The sun withholds its rays of light,
 2  The heav'ns are clothed in shades of night,
 2  While Jesus wins the glorious fight,
 2     On the cross! On the cross!
 
 3  By faith we see Him lifted up,
 3     On the cross! On the cross!
 3  He drinks for us the bitter cup,
 3     On the cross! On the cross!
 3  The rocks do rend, the mountains quake,
 3  While Jesus all our sins doth take,
 3  While Jesus suffers for our sake,
 3     On the cross! On the cross!
 
 4  And now the mighty deed is done,
 4     On the cross! On the cross!
 4  The battle fought, the vict'ry won,
 4     On the cross! On the cross!
 4  To heav'n He turns triumphant eyes;
 4  " 'Tis finished" now, the Conqu'ror cries,
 4  Then bows His sacred head and dies,
 4     On the cross! On the cross!
 
 5  But now He's ris'n, ascended, crowned,
 5     On the throne! On the throne!
 5  Heav'n's highest place for Him is found,
 5     On the throne! On the throne!
 5  Our hearts we low in worship bow,
 5  And join, as one, to hail Him now:
 5  "Worthy, O Lamb of God, art Thou!"
 5     On the throne! On the throne!
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next

 1  Would He devote that sacred head
 1     For such a worm as I?

 2     He groaned upon the tree?

 2     And love beyond degree!

 3     And shut his glories in,

 3     For man, His creature's sin.

 4     While His dear cross appears
 4  Dissolve my heart in thankfulness,
 4     And melt mine eyes to tears.
 
 5  But drops of grief can ne'er repay
 5     The debt of love I owe;
 5  Here, Lord, I give myself away:
 5     'Tis all that I can do.

 1  Or mercy could not come
 1     To ruined sinners nigh;
 1  Yes Christ, the Son of God, must bleed,
 1  That sinners might from sin be freed.
 
 2  Himself He could not save,
 2     For justice must be done;
 2  Our sins' full weight must fall
 2     Upon the sinless One;
 2  For nothing less can God accept
 2  In payment of that fearful debt.

 3     For He the Surety stood
 3  For all who now rely
 3     Upon His precious blood;
 3  He bore the penalty of guilt
 3  When on the cross His blood was spilt.
 
 4  Himself He could not save,
 4     What wondrous love is this!
 4  In love Himself He gave,
 4     There ne'er was love like His!
 4  Such love should melt a heart of stone,
 4  Till praise flows forth to Him alone!

 1  The Lord of glory crucified!

 2  And death is our eternal gain.

 3     While gazing on that cross!

 3  Our hearts were broken by that cry,
 3  "Eli, lama sabachthani!"

 4     That vengeance was our due;

 5     Raised with Thee from the dead;

 5  Shall with Thee in Thy glories shine,
 5     The Church's living Head!
 5  We, who were worthy but to die,

 1  It well becomes the saints of God;
 1  Should we refuse our songs to raise,
 1  The stones might tell our shame abroad.
 
 2  For Him Who washed us in His blood,
 2  Let us our sweetest songs prepare;
 2  He sought us wandering far from God,
 2  And now preserves us by His care.
 
 3  One string there is of sweetest tone,
 3  Reserved for sinners saved by grace;
 3  'Tis sacred to one class alone
 3  And touched by one peculiar race.
 
 4  Though angels may with rapture see
 4  How mercy flows in Jesus' blood,
 4  It is not theirs to prove, as we,
 4  The cleansing virtue of this flood.
 
 5  Though angels praise the heavenly King,
 5  And worship Him as God alone,
 5  We can with exultation sing,
 5  "He wears our nature on the throne."
 
 6  Lord, we adore Thy wondrous love,
 6  Which brought Thee here to bleed and die
 6  That Thou lost sinners may restore
 6  And to the Father bring them nigh.

 1     What Thou hast done for me!
 1  Thou art divine, mysterious,
 1     Beyond my grandest phrase!

 1     Beyond all pow'r to praise!

 2     That we may be redeemed.

 2     That we accepted be;
 2  Regenerated by Thy life,
 2     We now are one with Thee.

 3     The many grains to bear,
 3  Which, blent and formed, Thy Body are,
 3     And all Thy nature share.
 3  We are the increase of Thyself,
 3     And Thou our content art;
 3  Through us Thou livest and dost move
 3     And manifested art.
 
 4  Since we're Thy Body, Thou may come
 4     And settle down in us;
 4  In us Thou may obtain Thy home
 4     And we become Thy trust.
 4  Thy heart to satisfy and please,
 4     We are Thy counterpart,
 4  Now in one Body with Thyself,
 4     Enjoying all Thou art.
 
 5  While in remembrance now we meet
 5     And here the symbols see,
 5  For Thy redemption great and full
 5     We're filled with praise to Thee.
 5  Since we are made Thy Body, Lord,
 5     Thy dwelling place and bride,
 5  We would give thanks and worship Thee
 5     And in Thy praise abide.

 1  Christ is risen! Hallelujah!
 1  Risen our victorious Head;
 1  Sing His praises; Hallelujah!
 1  Christ is risen from the dead.
 1  Gratefully our hearts adore Him,
 1  As His light once more appears;
 1  Bowing down in joy before Him,
 1  Rising up from griefs and tears.
 
Christ is risen: Hallelujah!
Risen our victorious Head;
Sing His praises; Hallelujah!
Christ is risen from the dead.
 
 2  Christ is risen! All the sadness
 2  Of His earthly life is o'er;
 2  Through the open gates of gladness
 2  He returns to life once more;
 2  Death and hell before Him bending,
 2  He doth rise the Victor now,
 2  Angels on His steps attending,
 2  Glory round His wounded brow.
 
Christ is risen: Hallelujah!
Risen our victorious Head;
Sing His praises; Hallelujah!
Christ is risen from the dead.
 
 3  Christ is risen! Henceforth never
 3  Death nor hell shall us enthrall;
 3  We are Christ's, in Him forever
 3  We have triumphed over all;
 3  All the doubting and dejection
 3  Of our trembling hearts have ceased,
 3  'Tis His day of resurrection;
 3  Let us rise and keep the feast.
 
Christ is risen: Hallelujah!
Risen our victorious Head;
Sing His praises; Hallelujah!
Christ is risen from the dead.
 
Verses:  1   2   3

 1  O how deep and how far-reaching
 1     Is Thy love, dear Lord, to me!
 1  Far beyond my pow'r to fathom,
 1     Deeper than the deepest sea!
 1  It has caused Thee death to suffer
 1     And to me Thyself impart,
 1  That in Thee I might be grafted
 1     And become of Thee a part.
 
 2  Who can tell of all the wonders
 2     Which Thy love for me has wrought,
 2  Yet the greatest of these wonders
 2     Is that Thou to me art brought.
 2  Oh! To me Thy love has given
 2     All Thou art as my supply;
 2  As true life I now may share Thee
 2     And Thy riches e'er enjoy.
 
 3  Lord, Thy love is the expression
 3     Of Thy loving self divine,
 3  Making life so full of meaning,
 3     Harmonized with God's design.
 3  Grace of life, how all-sufficient,
 3     Is my portion day by day;
 3  I'm the object of Thy favor
 3     And Thy sweetness taste alway.
 
 4  What from Thee can separate me?
 4     Thou wilt love me to the end!
 4  Oh! Thy love is so prevailing,
 4     E'en Thyself with me to blend!
 4  We two one will be for ever;
 4     I am Thine and Thou art mine!
 4  This will be my testimony:
 4     In Thy love we'll ever twine!

 1  My Savior, Jesus; yet this soul of mine
 1  Would of Thy love in all its breadth and length,
 1  Its height and depth, its everlasting strength,
 1              Know more and more.
 
 2  It passeth telling, that dear love of Thine,
 2  My Savior, Jesus; yet these lips of mine
 2  Would fain proclaim to sinners, far and near,

 2              And love beget.

 3  My Savior Jesus; yet this heart of mine
 3  Would sing that love, so full, so rich, so free,
 3  Which brings a rebel sinner, such as me,
 3              Nigh unto God.

 4  The fullness of Thy love, while here below,
 4  My empty vessel I may freely bring;
 4  O Thou, who art of love the living spring,
 4              My vessel fill.

 5  Or look of love to Thee I've ever brought;
 5  Yet I may come, and come again to Thee,
 5  With this the empty sinner's only plea,
 5              Thou lovest me.
 
 6  Oh, fill me, Jesus, Savior, with Thy love!
 6  Lead, lead me to the living fount above;
 6  Thither may I, in simple faith draw nigh,
 6  And never to another fountain fly,
 6              But unto Thee.
 
 7  Lord Jesus, when Thee face to face I see,
 7  When on Thy lofty throne I sit with Thee,
 7  Then of Thy love, in all its breadth and length,
 7  Its height and depth, its everlasting strength,
 7              My soul shall sing.

Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
 
 1  I have a Friend, whose faithful love
 1  Is more than all the world to me:
 1  'Tis higher than the heights above,
 1  And deeper than the soundless sea;
 1           So old, so new,
 1           So strong, so true;
 1  Before the earth received its frame,
 1  He loved me - Blessed be His name!
 
 2  He held the highest place above,
 2  Adored by all the sons of flame,
 2  Yet such His self-denying love,
 2  He laid aside His crown and came
 2           To seek the lost,
 2           And at the cost
 2  Of heavenly rank and earthly fame
 2  He sought me - Blessed be His name!
 
 3  It was a lonely path He trod,
 3  From every human soul apart;
 3  Known only to Himself and God
 3  Was all the grief that filled His heart,
 3           Yet from the track
 3           He turned not back,
 3  Till where I lay in want and shame,
 3  He found me - Blessed be His name!
 
 4  Then dawned at last that day of dread,
 4  When desolate, yet undismayed,
 4  With wearied frame and thorn-crowned head,
 4  He, God-forsaken, man-betrayed,
 4           Was then made sin
 4           On Calvary,
 4  And, dying there in grief and shame,
 4  He saved me - Blessed be His name!
 
 5  Long as I live my song shall tell
 5  The wonders of His dying love;
 5  And when at last I go to dwell
 5  With Him His sovereign grace to prove,
 5           My joy shall be
 5           His face to see,
 5  And bowing there with loud acclaim
 5  I'll praise Him-Blessed be His name!

Hymns, #162
Praise of the Lord - His Salvation

E162 C- K- S78 T162

Lyrics
:
A. T. Pierson
Music
:
Philip P. Bliss
Meter
:
11.12.12.12

Hymn using same tune:
#947
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
 
 1  With praise and thanksgiving there stands a great throng
 1  In the presence of Jesus and sing this new song.
 
Unto Him Who hath loved us and
   washed us from sin,
Unto Him be the glory forever!
   Amen!
 
 2  All these once were sinners, defiled in His sight,
 2  Now arrayed in pure garments, in praise they unite.
 
Unto Him Who hath loved us and
   washed us from sin,
Unto Him be the glory forever!
   Amen!
 
 3  He maketh the rebel a priest and a king,
 3  He hath bought us, and taught us this new song to sing.
 
Unto Him Who hath loved us and
   washed us from sin,
Unto Him be the glory forever!
   Amen!
 
 4  How helpless and hopeless we sinners had been,
 4  If He never had loved us till cleansed from our sin.
 
Unto Him Who hath loved us and
   washed us from sin,
Unto Him be the glory forever!
   Amen!
 
 5  Aloud in His praises our voices shall ring,
 5  So that others, believing, this new song shall sing.
 
Unto Him Who hath loved us and
   washed us from sin,
Unto Him be the glory forever!
   Amen!
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #163
Praise of the Lord - His Grace

E163 C135 K135 S79 T163

Lyrics
:
Charles Wesley
Music
:
Carl Gottholf Glaser, arr. by Lowell Mason & Arr. from William Gardiner
Meter
:
8.6.8.6

Hymns using same tune:
Tune 2: #197, #200 (Tune 1)
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
 
 1  O for a thousand tongues to sing
 1     My great Redeemer's praise,
 1  The glories of my God and King,
 1     The triumphs of His grace.
 
 2  My gracious Master and my God,
 2     Assist me to proclaim,
 2  To spread through all the earth abroad,
 2     The honors of Thy name.
 
 3  Jesus! The name that charms our fears,
 3     That bids our sorrows cease;
 3  'Tis music in the sinner's ears,
 3     'Tis life, and health, and peace.
 
 4  His love my heart has captive made,
 4     His captive would I be,
 4  For He was bound, and scourged and died,
 4     My captive soul to free.
 
 5  He breaks the power of canceled sin,
 5     He sets the prisoner free;
 5  His blood can make the foulest clean;
 5     His blood availed for me.
 
 6  So now Thy blessed Name I love,
 6     Thy will would e'er be mine.
 6  Had I a thousand hearts to give,
 6     My Lord, they all were Thine!
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #164
Praise of the Lord - His Grace

E164 C- K- S- T164

Lyrics
:
S. Trevor Francis
Music
:
P. Skene
Meter
:
10.9.10.9

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  Let me sing, for the glory of heaven
 1  Like a sunbeam has swept o'er my heart;
 1  I would praise Thee for sins all forgiven,
 1  For Thy love, which shall never depart.
 
 2  If Thy works praise Thee, Giver of good,
 2  If the sun shines his praise unto Thee,
 2  If the wind, as it sighs through the wood,
 2  Makes a murmur of song from each tree,
 
 3  Then these lips, sure, a tribute shall bring,
 3  Though unworthy the praises must be;
 3  Shall all nature be vocal and sing,
 3  And no psalm of rejoicing from me?
 
 4  O wonderful, glorious Redeemer!
 4  I would worship Thee, Savior Divine;
 4  And rejoice, though surrounded with praises,
 4  Thou wilt still hear a song such as mine.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #165

E165 C- K- S- T165

Music

From Neuvermehrtes Meiningisches Gesangbuch, 1693, harmony by Felix Mendelssohn
Meter
:
7.6.7.6.D

Hymn using same tune:
#803
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3 
 
 1  My song shall be of Jesus;
 1     His mercy crowns my days,
 1  He fills my cup with blessings,
 1     And tunes my heart to praise.
 1  My song shall be of Jesus,
 1     The precious Lamb of God,
 1  Who gave Himself my ransom,
 1     And bought me with His blood.
 
 2  My song shall be of Jesus
 2     When, sitting at His feet,
 2  I call to mind His goodness
 2     In meditation sweet:
 2  My song shall be of Jesus,
 2     Whatever ill betide;
 2  I'll sing the grace that saves me,
 2     And keeps me at His side.
 
 3  My song shall be of Jesus
 3     While pressing on my way
 3  To reach the blissful kingdom
 3     Of pure and perfect day:
 3  And when my soul shall enter
 3     That realm of splendor fair,
 3  A song of praise to Jesus
 3     I'll sing forever there.
 
Verses:  1   2   3

Hymns, #166
Praise of the Lord - His Goodness

E166 C- K- S- T166

Lyrics
:
Joachim Neander, tr. by Catherine Winkworth
Music
:
From Praxis Pietatis Melica, 1668
Meter
:
14.14.4.7.8

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
 
 1  Praise to the Lord, the Almighty, the King of creation!
 1  O my soul, praise Him, for He is thy health and salvation!
 1        All ye who hear,
 1  Now to His temple draw near;
 1  Sing now in glad adoration!
 
 2  Praise to the Lord, who o'er all things so wondrously reigneth,
 2  Who, as on wings of an eagle, uplifteth, sustaineth.
 2        Hast thou not seen
 2  How thy desires all have been
 2  Granted in what He ordaineth?
 
 3  Praise to the Lord, who hath fearfully, wondrously, made thee!
 3  Health hath vouchsafed and, when heedlessly falling, hath stayed thee.
 3        What need or grief
 3  Ever hath failed of relief?
 3  Wings of His mercy did shade thee.
 
 4  Praise to the Lord, who doth prosper thy work and defend thee,
 4  Who from the heavens the streams of His mercy doth send thee.
 4        Ponder anew
 4  What the Almighty can do,
 4  Who with His love doth befriend thee.
 
 5  Praise to the Lord! Oh, let all that is in me adore Him!
 5  All that hath life and breath, come now with praises before Him!
 5        Let the Amen
 5  Sound from His people again;
 5  Gladly for aye we adore Him.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next

Hymns, #168
Praise of the Lord - His Goodness

E168 C- K- S- T168

Lyrics
:
Samuel Medley
Music
:
Unknown
Meter
:
8.8.8.8

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  Now in a song of grateful praise,
 1  To Thee, O Lord, my voice I'll raise;
 1  With all Thy saints I'll join to tell,
 1  My Savior has done all things well.
 
And above the rest this note shall swell,
This note shall swell, this note shall swell,
And above the rest this note shall swell,
My Savior has done all things well.
 
 2  How sov'reign, wonderful and free,
 2  Has been Thy love to sinful me!
 2  Thou sav'dst me from the jaws of hell;
 2  My Savior has done all things well.
 
And above the rest this note shall swell,
This note shall swell, this note shall swell,
And above the rest this note shall swell,
My Savior has done all things well.
 
 3  Since e'er my soul has known His love,
 3  What mercies He has made me prove,
 3  Mercies which do all praise excel,
 3  My Savior has done all things well.
 
And above the rest this note shall swell,
This note shall swell, this note shall swell,
And above the rest this note shall swell,
My Savior has done all things well.
 
 4  And when on that bright day I rise,
 4  And join the anthems of the skies,
 4  Above the rest this note shall swell,
 4  My Savior has done all things well.
 
And above the rest this note shall swell,
This note shall swell, this note shall swell,
And above the rest this note shall swell,
My Savior has done all things well.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4

Hymns, #169
Praise of the Lord - His Sweetness

E169 C138 K138 S- T169

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Arr. from Chretien d'Urhan, 1834, arr. by Edward F. Rimbault
Meter
:
7.6.7.6.D

*henna: an Old World plant, prized for its fragrant yellow and white flowers. (Song of Songs 1:!4)
Hymns using same tune:
#206, #1323
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8 
 
 
 1  Thou, Lord, to God art precious,
 1     His chosen, His delight;
 1  With oil of joy, anointed,
 1     How comely in His sight.
 
We treasure with affection
   Thy perfect comeliness,
Thy sweetness and Thy fragrance,
   And all Thy loveliness.
 
 2  The altogether lovely,
 2     The fairest of the fair,
 2  Thy mouth with grace o'erfloweth;
 2     Our hearts their love declare.
 
We treasure with affection
   Thy perfect comeliness,
Thy sweetness and Thy fragrance,
   And all Thy loveliness.
 
 3  The wise men offered treasures
 3     And honored Thee at birth;
 3  Thou wast by noble buried,
 3     Still lovable in death.
 
We treasure with affection
   Thy perfect comeliness,
Thy sweetness and Thy fragrance,
   And all Thy loveliness.
 
 4  Thy head has been anointed,
 4     The lovely One Thou art;
 4  Thy feet anointed also,
 4     Beloved in every part.
 
We treasure with affection
   Thy perfect comeliness,
Thy sweetness and Thy fragrance,
   And all Thy loveliness.
 
 5  Thy death as myrrh in sweetness
 5     Man's spirit comforteth;
 5  Thy resurrection fragrance
 5     God's longing answereth.
 
We treasure with affection
   Thy perfect comeliness,
Thy sweetness and Thy fragrance,
   And all Thy loveliness.
 
 6  As henna* flow'rs, Thy beauty
 6     In loveliness complete;
 6  As apple trees that flourish,
 6     Thy fruit abundant, sweet.
 
We treasure with affection
   Thy perfect comeliness,
Thy sweetness and Thy fragrance,
   And all Thy loveliness.
 
 7  Sweet wine Thy love surpasseth,
 7     Thy name an ointment is;
 7  We take Thee as our love feast
 7     And taste the sweetest bliss.
 
We treasure with affection
   Thy perfect comeliness,
Thy sweetness and Thy fragrance,
   And all Thy loveliness.
 
 8  As on Thyself we ponder
 8     And all Thy beauty trace,
 8  We taste to full Thy sweetness
 8     And rest in Thine embrace.
 
We treasure with affection
   Thy perfect comeliness,
Thy sweetness and Thy fragrance,
   And all Thy loveliness.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #170
Praise of the Lord - His Beauty

E170 C140 K140 S80 T170

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
John B. Dykes
Meter
:
8.7.8.7

Hymns using same tune:
#22 (Tune 1), #90
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7 
 
 1  Lord, Thou art the lovely Bridegroom,
 1     God appointed, dear to us;
 1  Thy dear self is so, attractive,
 1     To our heart so beauteous!
 
 2  Dear Beloved, we admire Thee,
 2     Who can tell Thy preciousness;
 2  All Thy love we deeply treasure
 2     And Thine untold loveliness.
 
 3  Thou art fairer than the fairest,
 3     Thou art sweeter than the sweet;
 3  Thou art meek and Thou art gracious,
 3     None can e'er with Thee compete.
 
 4  Full of myrrh are all Thy garments,
 4     And Thy lips are filled with grace;
 4  In the savor of Thy suffering,
 4     We in love Thyself embrace.
 
 5  It is with the oil of gladness
 5     Thy God hath anointed Thee;
 5  From the palaces of ivory
 5     Praise shall ever rise to Thee.
 
 6  God hath blessed Thee, Lord, forever,
 6     Thou hast won the victory;
 6  Now we see Thee throned in glory
 6     With Thy pow'r and majesty.
 
 7  Thou art the desire of nations,
 7     All Thy worth they'll ever prove;
 7  Thou, the chiefest of ten thousand,
 7     Ever worthy of our love.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7
