Hymns, #1247
The Church - Following

E1247 C- K- S- T-

Lyrics
:
Unknown
Music
:
Ada Rose Gibbs
Meter
:
8.7.8.7.D

Hymns using same tune:
#268, #779, #925, #1155
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  If our hearts would be established;
 1  If in spirit we would be;
 1  If we would be overcomers;
 1  Follow Jesus constantly.
 
Follow Jesus in the spirit;
Be the overcomers true;
Follow Jesus every moment -
Jesus, help us follow You.
 
 2  If we would be built together;
 2  If related we would be;
 2  To be fitly framed together;
 2  Follow brothers constantly.
 
Follow brothers for the building;
Never independent be;
Follow brothers, be in order,
Functioning in harmony.
 
 3  If we're for the Lord's recovery;
 3  If the earth the Lord's would be;
 3  If we would bring in the kingdom;
 3  Follow churches constantly.
 
Follow all the local churches;
Thus, the kingdom we will see.
Follow in the churches' flowing
For the Lord's recovery.
 
 4  We would all be better followers,
 4  Taking in with joy the Word;
 4  It enables us to follow
 4  Brothers, churches, and our Lord.
 
Follow Jesus; follow brothers;
Follow churches in the flow;
By the Word of God amening
We can all attain this goal.

Hymns, #1248
The Church - Consecration for the Church

E1248 Cs603 K1001 S381 T1248

Lyrics
:
Unknown
Music
:
Unknown
Meter
:
Peculiar Meter

This hymn has a unique tune
*Repeat the last four lines
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  Recall how David swore,
 1  "I'll not come into my house,
 1  Nor go up to my bed,
 1  Give slumber to mine eyelids,
 1  Until I find a place for Thee,
 1  A place, O Lord, for Thee."
 1  Our mighty God desires a home
 1  Where all His own may come.
 
 2  How blinded we have been,
 2  Shut in with what concerns us;
 2  While God's house lieth waste -
 2  Lord, break through, overturn us;
 2  We'll go up to the mountain,
 2  Bring wood and build the house;
 2  We'll never say, "Another day!"
 2  It's time! We'll come and build!
 
 3  O Lord, against these days,
 3  Inspire some for Your building,
 3  Just as in David's day -
 3  A remnant who are willing
 3  To come and work in Your house,
 3  Oh, what a blessed charge!
 3  Your heart's desire, is our desire -
 3  We come, O Lord, to build.
 
 4  Within those whom You'd call
 4  Put such a restless caring
 4  For building to give all -
 4  These times are for preparing;
 4  The gates of hell cannot prevail
 4  Against the builded Church!
 4  The hours are few, the builders too -
 4  Lord, build, O build in us!
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4

Hymns, #1249
The Church - Consecration for the Church

E1249 C- K- S- T-

Lyrics
:
Unknown
Music
:
George C. Stebbins
Meter
:
8.7.8.7.D.(I)

Hymns using same tune:
#288, #910
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  How oft believers through the years
 1  Have sought the will of Jesus,
 1  And would have offered everything
 1  To walk as Him it pleases.
 1  If you should seek the will of God,
 1  Don't waste another minute;
 1  The church life is His glorious will,
 1  And you too must get in it.
 
 2  "What is the will of God for me?"
 2  How oft you've asked this question.
 2  It is the church life, corporately,
 2  Where God finds His expression.
 2  Don't watch the church life from afar,
 2  Or erringly construe it;
 2  Come gaze upon it from within -
 2  You'll give your whole life to it.
 
 3  The church life here is realized,
 3  'Tis all the Lord intended;
 3  And in this rich experience
 3  All further seeking's ended.
 3  The church life is His glorious will -
 3  Now for yourself begin it.
 3  The surest way to know His will
 3  Is simply to get in it.
 
 4  So let us give our all for this,
 4  And hold ourselves not dearly;
 4  The church life is the will of God,
 4  Let's take our standing clearly.
 4  Oh, we have found the will of God;
 4  Christ died and rose to win it.
 4  The church life is His glorious will,
 4  And, praise the Lord, we're in it!
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4

*Psalm 132
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
 
 
 1  O surely I will not come in
 1     Within my house to stay,
 1  Nor yet give sleep unto my eyes,
 1     Till Jesus has His way.
 1  Upon the earth, the Lord desires
 1     A place where He may live;
 1  For this, Thy habitation, Lord,
 1     Myself I fully give.
 
 2  We heard of it while yet far off,
 2     We found it in the way;
 2  We then came up into her courts,
 2     And here we'll ever stay.
 2  Arise, O Lord, into Thy rest,
 2     Thou and Thy ark so strong.
 2  Thy priests are clothed with righteousness;
 2     Thy saints with joy and song.
 
 3  The Lord has sworn in truth to us,
 3     He will not turn away -
 3  His Seed shall sit with Him enthroned,
 3     And reign with Him for aye.
 3  The Lord hath found a place to dwell,
 3     Hath chosen Zion fair;
 3  His habitation it will be,
 3     It is His rest fore'er.
 
 4  Her food abundant He will bless,
 4     Her needy, satisfy;
 4  And with salvation clothe her priests,
 4     And all her want supply.
 4  The horn of David's budding here,
 4     A lamp for earth's dark night.
 4  His enemies are clothed with shame,
 4     His saints with crowns of light.
 
 5  And now within these latter days,
 5     Amidst earth's dark unrest,
 5  God's house is being built again
 5     And all His people blessed.
 5  Secure within the local church,
 5     With saints in one accord
 5  We meet to just release our praise,
 5     And thus enjoy the Lord.

Hymns, #1263

Hymns using same tune:
#20, #43, #977, #1183, #1203, #1275
*The name of the city may be replaced with other names that fit the meter: e.g. San Diego, San Francisco. Or, the first line of each verse may be sung as follows: There's a living church in Dallas, Houston, Cleveland, etc.

Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
 
 
 1  There's a church in New York City*,
 1  Standing on the local ground;
 1  There's a lampstand brightly beaming,
 1  Shining out to millions 'round.
 1  We were raised from every nation,
 1  Every people, tribe, and tongue -
 1  With us God has gained a dwelling,
 1  'Tis where all His own may come.
 
 2  In your midst, O New York City,
 2  Little do you realize -
 2  Fallen is a seed within you,
 2  'Midst corruption it shall rise;
 2  Rising up in resurrection,
 2  With an increase many fold,
 2  It shall blossom, manifesting
 2  Riches of God's life untold.
 
 3  For the church in New York City
 3  Faithfully the saints have prayed.
 3  'Gainst the church in New York City
 3  How the devil is enraged!
 3  For behold, within the center
 3  Of his kingdom, dark and grim,
 3  God has gained a testimony,
 3  Moving, fighting on for Him.
 
 4  There's a church in New York City
 4  Who the gospel does proclaim,
 4  To the hungry, poor, and weary,
 4  Sick, imprisoned, and the lame.
 4  Now this gospel of the kingdom
 4  Shall be preached until the end;
 4  Till the Lord who with the kingdom
 4  Of the heavens does descend.

Now Jesus' testimony, we in the churches see,

Now we stand
As the Hebrews, Hallelujah,
On the sea! Praise the Lord!

 10  To us this mixture fully show.

 10  Until we're wholly absolute.

 11  Life is the way that we must go!
 11  She says she's living, but she's dead;
 11  She needs to touch the Lord instead.
 
 12  Lord, take us all the way to life
 12  To overcome the deadness rife.
 12  Away from deadness we would flee
 12  That full of life we'll always be.
 
 13  Now Philadelphia comes at last;
 13  That which she has she should hold fast -
 13  The brothers' love, the name, the word;
 13  This church has satisfied the Lord.
 
 14  We as the brothers all are one;
 14  We're one by life, and life alone.
 14  If we His word and name do keep
 14  A glorious building God will reap.
 
 15  Laodicea warns us all:
 15  From Philadelphia some will fall.
 15  By saying, "I am rich," it's then
 15  The Lord is outside wanting in.
 
 16  Lukewarmness we must ever spurn
 16  And in the spirit always burn,
 16  The inward life experience gain,
 16  And pay the price with Him to reign.
 
 17  Lord, shine Your light on us today
 17  That we may fully go Your way;
 17  Anoint our eyes and let us see
 17  So You can have recovery.

 1     He who's real speaks from above;

 2     Thine are works that please the Lord.
 2  Strength thou hast, though just a little
 2     And hast kept His living Word.
 2  Thou His holy name denied not,
 2     But confessed it here below -
 2  Lo, a door is set before thee,
 2     Through which none but thee can go.

 3     Dost His Word of patience keep.
 3  From the hour of trial He'll save thee,
 3     Which o'er all the world shall sweep.

 3     They to thee must then bow down.

 3     That no man may take thy crown."
 
 4  Hallelujah, overcomers,
 4     "In the temple of My God,
 4  I will build them in as pillars,
 4     Nevermore to go abroad."
 4  God's own name is written on them
 4     And the new name of the Lord.
 4  With the triune God they're blended;
 4     They're the city of our God.
 
 5  Hallelujah, out of heaven,
 5     Comes the New Jerusalem:
 5  Gates of pearl and walls of jasper,
 5     Mingled with each precious gem.
 5  Philadelphia, Philadelphia,
 5     Has become His Bride so dear.
 5  Now the Spirit in the churches
 5     Speaks to all who have an ear.

Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8 
 
 
 1  Oh, the Lord is quickly coming,
 1  He has spoken in His Word;
 1  And confirmed it by the churches,
 1  For His Spirit we have heard.
 
 2  Not to all the seven churches
 2  Did the Lord speak in this way;
 2  To the church in Philadelphia
 2  Did He choose these words to say.
 
 3  Philadelphia, Philadelphia,
 3  Church so full of brotherly love,
 3  You're the church to bring the Bridegroom
 3  Back to earth from heav'n above.
 
 4  He that hath the key of David,
 4  He that shuts and opens too,
 4  Knows thy works, O Philadelphia;
 4  That's why you're His Bride so true.
 
 5  Not so strong by worldly standards,
 5  Hidden from religion's fame;
 5  Jesus loves you, Philadelphia,
 5  For you're faithful to His name.
 
 6  By His Word you're overcoming -
 6  How the Amen does resound!
 6  Just hold fast to what you've gotten,
 6  That no man may take your crown.
 
 7  You have kept His Word of patience;
 7  He will keep you from that hour
 7  Which upon the whole world cometh
 7  When the Lord comes in His power.
 
 8  "I come quickly," Philadelphia,
 8  Speaks the Lord to none but you;
 8  "Amen! Quickly come, Lord Jesus,"
 8  Answer back His faithful few.

Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  In the church of Jesus there is love for you,
 1  Love most pure and tender, love most deep and true;
 1  Why should you be lonely, why for friendship sigh,
 1  When the church of Jesus has a full supply?
 
 2  In the church of Jesus there is life for you,
 2  Warm as summer sunshine, sweet as morning dew;
 2  Why should you be fearful, why take anxious thought,
 2  Since the church of Jesus cares for those He bought?
 
 3  In the church of Jesus there is work for you;
 3  Such as even angels might rejoice to do;
 3  Why stand idly sighing for some life work grand,
 3  While the church of Jesus seeks your reaping hand?
 
 4  In the church of Jesus there's a place for you;
 4  Glorious, bright, and joyous, right and peaceful too;
 4  Why then like a wand'rer, roam with weary pace,
 4  If the church of Jesus holds for you a place.

Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 
 1  All the meetings Christ appointed
 1     And attended here on earth
 1  Were apart from all religion,
 1     All its rituals, forms, and dearth.
 1  Resurrection, not religion,
 1     Must be our reality;
 1  Let us meet in resurrection,
 1     From all dead religion free.
 
 2  When the Lord was resurrected,
 2     All religious things were through;
 2  Christ is now our living temple,
 2     Christ is all our offerings too.
 2  With our Lord in resurrection,
 2     Hallelujah, we're released!
 2  Pity all the old religion -
 2     All our meetings are a feast!
 
 3  Yet religion - oh, how subtle -
 3     In our blood is hiding out;
 3  God must give us revelation,
 3     All that unseen monster rout.
 3  Lord, we still are too religious -
 3     Down with our religious soul!
 3  We would all release our spirit,
 3     Let each meeting reach the goal.
 
 4  In the meetings, in the meetings,
 4     On the mountain, at the shore,
 4  Jesus, Jesus, living Jesus,
 4     He is here - what want we more?
 4  Bury all the old religion,
 4     Even Christianity -
 4  Jesus, Jesus, we have Jesus,
 4     He is our reality!

:

Music
:
Martin Luther
Meter
:
Peculiar Meter

Hymns using same tune:
#886, #1198
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3 
 
 1  In Eden's garden, Satan thought
 1  He'd wreck the Lord's intention.
 1  And so, conspiring, then, he wrought
 1  His subtle intervention.
 1  To man he entered in,
 1  Became indwelling sin,
 1  And by this deed so bad
 1  He really thought he had
 1  Undone the Lord completely.
 
 2  'Twas all according to God's plan
 2  To trap the Devil, Satan.
 2  His sphere of moving narrowed now,
 2  Man's flesh his habitation;
 2  Though brilliant was his plan
 2  To enter into man,
 2  This man became instead
 2  The means to bruise his head,
 2  And finish him forever.

Coming again, coming again,
As the wise virgins we must be prepared!
   Jesus is coming again!
 
 2  From soul and self turn away,
 2  Look unto Jesus today;
 2  There is no time to delay -
 2     Jesus is coming again!
 
Coming again, coming again,
Time is swiftly passing by,
Soon we may hear the midnight cry!
Coming again, coming again,
As the wise virgins we must be prepared!
   Jesus is coming again!
 
 3  Foolish ones never will turn;
 3  When the Lord comes they will learn
 3  There is no oil left to burn -
 3     Jesus is coming again!
 
Coming again, coming again,
Time is swiftly passing by,
Soon we may hear the midnight cry!
Coming again, coming again,
As the wise virgins we must be prepared!
   Jesus is coming again!
 
 4  Wise virgins buy up the time;
 4  Never drunk with the world's wine,
 4  Filled in the spirit they shine -
 4     Jesus is coming again!
 
Coming again, coming again,
Time is swiftly passing by,
Soon we may hear the midnight cry!
Coming again, coming again,
As the wise virgins we must be prepared!
   Jesus is coming again!
 
 5  Let us go forth unto Him,
 5  Not only with our lamps trimmed,
 5  Buy the oil now lest they dim -
 5     Jesus is coming again!
 
Coming again, coming again,
Time is swiftly passing by,
Soon we may hear the midnight cry!
Coming again, coming again,
As the wise virgins we must be prepared!
   Jesus is coming again!
 
 6  Jesus is now on His way,
 6  Watch, for you know not the day;
 6  Ever in His presence stay -
 6     Jesus is coming again!
 
Coming again, coming again,
Time is swiftly passing by,
Soon we may hear the midnight cry!
Coming again, coming again,
As the wise virgins we must be prepared!
   Jesus is coming again!

Hymns, #1303

Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
 
 
 1  The kingdom of God is at hand:
 1  Ten virgins with lamps lit arise
 1  To go forth to meet the Bridegroom,
 1  But only five virgins are wise.
 1  The wise have abundance of oil,
 1  The foolish are empty instead;
 1  The wise used their time to buy oil,
 1  The others their chance forfeited.
 
 2  Lord Jesus, Thy message is clear:
 2  You're coming for those who are wise,
 2  Who buy up their oil today,
 2  Who deal with all hindering ties.
 2  Those virgins whose souls are transformed,
 2  Whose vessels much oil contain,
 2  Who love not their lives unto death -
 2  They in Thy great kingdom shall reign.
 
 3  Our lamps to shine forth must be trimmed
 3  By calling on Thee every day.
 3  In spirit we must exercise
 3  To burn all the oldness away.
 3  But there is a much deeper need:
 3  Reality in us must grow,
 3  Until it make home in our hearts,
 3  Till oil in our vessels o'erflows.
 
 4  We see how this age is so dark,
 4  We know that blest hour is near.
 4  Our Lord may return anytime -
 4  Lord, strike in us this holy fear,
 4  That we may each moment redeem
 4  By taking Thy Word in by prayer,
 4  By learning each lesson You give,
 4  And thus for that hour prepare.
 
 5  Lord Jesus, how blest to be those
 5  Who bring in Thy kingdom to earth,
 5  Affording Thee rule over all
 5  And showing to all Thy great worth!
 5  How blest to be those at the feast,
 5  Where Thou wilt be one with Thy Bride!
 5  Lord, make us wise virgins for Thee,
 5  Who e'er in Thy presence abide.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5

Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 1  The day approaches; Jesus soon is coming.
 1  Redeem the time; it must not slip away.
 1  Lord, make us ready for the cry: "Behold Him!"
 1  By using every moment of each day.
 
When Jesus comes, will we go in to meet Him?
When Jesus comes, will we from self have ceased?
He's coming soon to take the wise ones with Him.
Oh, let us not be left outside the feast.
 
 2  Lord, help us to redeem these golden moments;
 2  Our vessels fill with ointment from above;
 2  Help us amen each trial and tribulation;
 2  Increase in us; make us abound in love.
 
He's coming soon - these moments are so precious.
The oil is here - Oh, let us buy the more.
Amen the trials and welcome tribulations -
The kingdom's ours through these afflictions sore.
 
 3  Lord, ever turn us from our soulish pleasures
 3  To gaze upon Thy tender, loving face.
 3  Oh, keep us running forth to meet the Bridegroom
 3  And patiently attending to the race.
 
When Jesus comes, will we be in His presence?
When Jesus comes, will we His face behold?
Oh, let us not return to sloth and folly,
But jealously His loving presence hold.
 
 4  As His dear Bride, let us go forth to meet Him,
 4  Our lamps well-trimmed, our fires burning bright,
 4  Our vessels filled, our eyes set on His glory,
 4  To be with Him completely satisfied.
 
Yes, satisfied - Christ and His Bride together,
Yes, satisfied - throughout eternity.
Oh, what a rest, what joy, what love, what favor
To be His Bride when He comes to His feast!

 1  Rejoice! Rejoice! Our Bridegroom's coming,
 1     And the time will not be long
 1  Before we hail that wedding morning
 1     And lift up the glad new song.
 
Oh, wondrous day! Oh, glorious morning,
   When the Christ we love shall come;
With vessels filled and lamps all burning
   Let us welcome His return.

   And the time will not be long
Before we hail that wedding morning
   And lift up the glad new song.

   Let us welcome His return.

   And the time will not be long
Before we hail that wedding morning
   And lift up the glad new song.

 3     For our wedding with the Lord,

   And the time will not be long

   And lift up the glad new song.
 
 4  Oh, with what rapture and rejoicing
 4     Shall the wedding day begin;

 4     At the marriage feast with Him!
 
Oh, wondrous day! Oh, glorious morning,

Verses:  1   2   3   4   5 
 
 1  When our Lord comes in glory and we're raptured to His side,
 1  When that bright and glorious moment we shall see,
 1  We shall know our dear Bridegroom as He comes to take His Bride,
 1  And He'll know the Bride He's loved so tenderly.
 
We shall know Him! We shall know Him!
When we see Him, our Bridegroom glorified!
He shall know us! He shall know us!
We're His church, His beloved, and His Bride!
 
 2  Even now in the Spirit He reveals Himself to us,
 2  And His Person dear we've learned to recognize.
 2  But our eyes shall behold Him - O what rapture glorious
 2  When we gaze on Him unveiled in the skies!
 
We shall know Him! We shall know Him!
When we see Him, our Bridegroom glorified!
He shall know us! He shall know us!
We're His church, His beloved, and His Bride!
 
 3  In the Word we have seen Him shining forth in truth and grace,
 3  O how blessed to behold His features thus!
 3  But the day soon is coming when we'll see Him face to face,
 3  He, the living Word, in full revealed to us.
 
We shall know Him! We shall know Him!
When we see Him, our Bridegroom glorified!
He shall know us! He shall know us!
We're His church, His beloved, and His Bride!
 
 4  In the brothers and sisters, O how blest to see the Lord,
 4  In their attitudes and actions Christ expressed!
 4  But the day soon is coming when in rapturous accord
 4  We shall see His Person fully manifest.
 
We shall know Him! We shall know Him!
When we see Him, our Bridegroom glorified!
He shall know us! He shall know us!
We're His church, His beloved, and His Bride!
 
 5  In the meetings of the churches He's unveiled increasingly -
 5  O the joy unspeakable and glory too!
 5  As the meetings grow higher we're expecting soon to see
 5  The full glory of our Lord come into view.
 
We shall know Him! We shall know Him!
When we see Him, our Bridegroom glorified!
He shall know us! He shall know us!
We're His church, His beloved, and His Bride!

Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 
 1  'Twas a day in early springtime,
 1  By an ancient wayside well,
 1  Eliezer paused to rest his camel train.
 1  He had found a bride for Isaac
 1  Ere the evening shadows fell,
 1  For his weary journey had not been in vain.
 
Oh, get ready! Evening shadows fall,
Don't you hear the Eliezer call?
There's going to be a wedding,
And our joy will soon begin,
In the evening when the camel train comes in.
 
 2  So he took the fair Rebekah,
 2  Dressed in jewels rich and rare,
 2  Quickly to her waiting bridegroom far away.
 2  Where Rebekah loved her Isaac,
 2  And he loved Rebekah fair;
 2  Oh, it must have been a happy wedding day.
 
Oh, get ready! Evening shadows fall,
Don't you hear the Eliezer call?
There's going to be a wedding,
And our joy will soon begin,
In the evening when the camel train comes in.
 
 3  Now the blessed Holy Spirit,
 3  From our Father God above,
 3  Has come down to earth to find a worthy Bride.
 3  For our Isaac over yonder
 3  Has prepared His tents of love,
 3  And He wants His fair Rebekah by His side.
 
Oh, get ready! Evening shadows fall,
Don't you hear the Eliezer call?
There's going to be a wedding,
And our joy will soon begin,
In the evening when the camel train comes in.
 
 4  We have left our kinfolk gladly;
 4  We have bade the world goodbye.
 4  We've been called to be His pure and spotless Bride;
 4  Where we'll soon behold our Jesus
 4  In that blest eternity -
 4  What a happy, happy wedding that will be!
 
Oh, get ready! Evening shadows fall,
Don't you hear the Eliezer call?
There's going to be a wedding,
And our joy will soon begin,
In the evening when the camel train comes in.

 1  That which for long the prophets sought,
 1  The righteous yearned to see,
 1  Has in these last of days appeared
 1  In its reality.
 
And we're now in the final stages,
'Tis the completion of all the ages.
All those who believed the promise
Are perfected now in us.
 
 2  Oh, blessed are our eyes that see,
 2  Our ears, how blessed to hear;
 2  Things angels ne'er could look into
 2  Are now to us made clear.
 
And we're now in the final stages,
'Tis the completion of all the ages.
All those who believed the promise
Are perfected now in us.
 
 3  Our sense is corporate, bold and strong,
 3  His grace, how free to take;
 3  Encouraging the others on,
 3  Run for the kingdom's sake.
 
And we're now in the final stages,
'Tis the completion of all the ages.
All those who believed the promise
Are perfected now in us.
 
 4  We're weary not this race to run,
 4  It makes our joy complete;
 4  For this we know, around the bend,
 4  The Lord we'll surely meet.
 
And we're now in the final stages,
'Tis the completion of all the ages.
All those who believed the promise
Are perfected now in us.

Hymns, #1321
Hope of Glory - The Manifestation of the Sons of God

E1321 C- K- S- T-

Lyrics
:
Unknown
Music
:
Richard S. Willis
Meter
:
8.6.8.6.D

Hymns using same tune:
#193, #960
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
 
 1  The grace which God bestows on us
 1  Is just His Son in full;
 1  The rich enjoyment of this Christ
 1  Is plenteous, bountiful.
 1  'Tis far too great to comprehend,
 1  Too wondrous to contain:
 1  How we, once children of despair,
 1  God's masterpiece became.
 
 2  The whole creation now beneath
 2  The weight of bondage sore,
 2  In seeing God's sons manifest
 2  Is freed forevermore.
 2  Th' eternal purpose of our God
 2  Will be full manifest;
 2  The hope of glory now concealed
 2  Is then to all expressed.
 
 3  The briars will be myrtle trees,
 3  The thorn will be no more,
 3  And peace will reign where war did rage,
 3  The curse will then be o'er.
 3  'Tis then the trees shall clap their hands,
 3  And all the hills shall sing;
 3  This glorious freedom shall God's sons
 3  Thus manifested bring.
 
 4  God's deepest work of grace goes on
 4  Each day, though hidden, small,
 4  Until that day, when manifest,
 4  It is revealed to all.
 4  By then God's wrought His finished work:
 4  Himself dispensed to us;
 4  And all creation 'round admires
 4  His product, glorious.
 
 5  The angels that before our God
 5  In brightest splendor stand,
 5  Will join the universal praise
 5  To Him for all He's planned.
 5  And of the devil, of his end . . . ?
 5  We'll praise the Lord for how
 5  Just distant smoke is all that's left
 5  Of all that troubles now.
 
 6  So shall we not delight to give
 6  Ourselves in every way,
 6  And let the Lord dispense Himself
 6  Into us more each day;
 6  The grace that we receive each day,
 6  Though hidden oft, and small,
 6  Is God Himself wrought into us,
 6  That day to shine o'er all.
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6

Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8   9 
 
 1  In spirit, in the church we see
 1  The high estate we're destined for.
 1  It's higher, vaster, more profound
 1  Than anything we've seen before.
 
 2  It's not a view in doctrine bare
 2  But an unveiling of the Christ.
 2  He's marvelous and far beyond
 2  Our mental thought or power to share.
 
 3  He's rich, unlimited, profound,
 3  Immeasurable, and marvelous.
 3  Yet 'tis a greater wonder still
 3  He needs heirs of salvation - us.
 
 4  God has accomplished many things -
 4  He's planned, created, and brought forth.
 4  The Son is now appointed Heir,
 4  Administrator of God's worth.
 
 5  But in th' economy of God
 5  There is not one, but many sons.
 5  One is the firstborn Son of God
 5  With many other living ones.
 
 6  Christ will inherit all God's things,
 6  And we're the heirs of God with Christ.
 6  We're growing now to be matured;
 6  As heirs we'll soon be legalized.
 
 7  We're joint-heirs with the firstborn Son,
 7  Inheriting the universe.
 7  We're in this corporation vast -
 7  All partners of Christ and the church.
 
 8  In spirit, in the church, we see
 8  Our calling of unrivaled worth.
 8  We're destined, not to go to heaven.
 8  We're destined to be kings on earth.
 
 9  We're paupers, yet we're glorious kings.
 9  Inheriting the kingdom vast,
 9  The earth, God's throne, and e'en all things
 9  And all the Father is and has.

 1  Behold, He quickly comes;
 1  He leaps upon the mountains,
 1  And o'er the hills He runs.
 1  The signs of His appearing
 1  Are seen on every side;
 1  The Bridegroom soon is coming
 1  To claim His loving Bride.
 
 2  How real that He is coming -
 2  Come quickly, Lord, again!
 2  We watch for His appearing,
 2  His precious Word amen.
 2  Oh, don't delay His coming,
 2  Pray without ceasing, pray;
 2  He's eagerly awaiting
 2  That coming wedding day.

 4  The sweetest chords are stirred.

 5  And all, Beloved, is Thine.
 5  The day is quickly dawning,
 5  The shadows flee away;
 5  Upon the mount of spices
 5  Our Lord may come today.

Hymns, #1324
Ultimate Manifestation - God's Eternal Purpose

E1324 C- K- S- T-

Lyrics
:
Unknown
Music
:
Unknown
Meter
:
8.7.8.7.D

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8   9 
 
 1  Our God is a God of purpose,
 1  What He plans, He will fulfill!
 1  Genesis to Revelation
 1  Shows His full and glorious will.
 1  What He's after is a building.
 1  In creation He began
 1  With a simple garden planted -
 1  This, the setting for His plan.
 
 2  Man was made, the first step God took
 2  To achieve His final goal,
 2  As a vessel, a container,
 2  Three parts - body, spirit, soul.
 2  God, of dust, a body formed him,
 2  Breath of life into him breathed -
 2  This part is man's human spirit
 2  By which God may be received.
 
 3  In the garden God had planted
 3  Every tree He made to grow,
 3  Good for food, to sight most pleasing,
 3  And the tree of life also!
 3  Second, then, in God's intention
 3  Was that man should freely eat
 3  Of the life-tree in the center
 3  To obtain His life complete.
 
 4  Third, we see a river flowing,
 4  Out of Eden coming forth,
 4  With its flow in four directions -
 4  East and west and south and north.
 4  As on Christ our life we're feeding,
 4  Living water in us flows.
 4  Hallelujah for this river
 4  And the watering it bestows!
 
 5  In the flowing of the river
 5  Gold, pearl, onyx stone we see;
 5  Three materials, raw yet precious,
 5  For God's building meant to be.
 5  Look, these elements are shining!
 5  How can we, then, shine as they?
 5  Simply by the Lord, the Spirit,
 5  Us transforming every day.
 
 6  God the Father (in this fourth step),
 6  Source of life, is gold divine;
 6  Christ the Son was wounded by us
 6  To produce the pearl so fine.
 6  God the Spirit brings the stones forth -
 6  Transformation of the clay.
 6  By the flowing of the Spirit
 6  Changed we'll be from day to day.
 
 7  Insufficient are materials
 7  Precious though they be and best;
 7  These must be built up together
 7  That God's house they may express.
 7  Fifth step: We ourselves hand over
 7  To the building that we be
 7  Built into God's house, His dwelling,
 7  One in each locality.
 
 8  Finally, in Revelation,
 8  Is the picture of Christ's Bride -
 8  Consummation of God's purpose;
 8  He is fully satisfied.
 8  New Jerusalem, a city,
 8  Is the Bridegroom's counterpart -
 8  So the church built up together
 8  Forms the Bride for Christ's own heart.
 
 9  How can we, as those who truly
 9  Long to see God reach His goal,
 9  Be united and related?
 9  By denial of our soul!
 9  As we contact Christ in spirit,
 9  Feed on Him as life to us,
 9  Then His life will flow, transform us
 9  To His Bride, all glorious!
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6   7   8   9 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #1325
Ultimate Manifestation - God's Eternal Purpose

E1325 C- K- S459 T1325

Lyrics
:
Unknown
Music
:
Annie F. Harrison
Meter
:
8.7.8.7.D

Hymns using same tune:
#589, #1136
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4   5   6 
 
 1  God eternal has a purpose,
 1  Formed in His eternal past,
 1  Spreading to eternal future;
 1  'Twixt these ends all time is cast.
 1  For with time there is the process,
 1  Time for His accomplishment;
 1  And in time we're merely travelers -
 1  For eternity we're meant.
 
 2  God would have a group of people
 2  Built together in His plan,
 2  Blended, knit, coordinated
 2  As His vessel - one new man.
 2  God would come into this vessel
 2  With His nature, life and ways,
 2  Mingling Spirit with our spirits
 2  For His joy and to His praise.
 
 3  God has worked in three directions
 3  For His plan so marvelous:
 3  As the Father, Son, and Spirit
 3  To dispense Himself to us!
 3  All creation gives the setting -
 3  Heav'n and earth are for this plan;
 3  'Tis for this God made a body,
 3  Soul and spirit - three-part man.
 
 4  As the center, as the kernel,
 4  Of God's plan our spirit is;
 4  Calling on the name of Jesus
 4  Makes our spirit one with His.
 4  From the center to circumference
 4  God would saturate each part;
 4  Feeling, mind, and will renewing,
 4  Making home in all our heart.
 
 5  Thus in life we're built together,
 5  Then in love we're knit as one;
 5  God is now His plan fulfilling,
 5  Finishing what He's begun.
 5  Lord, increase Thyself within us
 5  That we might be built by Thee
 5  Into that great corporate vessel
 5  Filled with God exclusively.
 
 6  As the product, the fulfillment,
 6  Will the church in glory stand,
 6  Consummation of the purpose
 6  In eternal ages planned.
 6  God will have His corporate vessel,
 6  All his glory to contain;
 6  Lord, we're wholly for Thy purpose
 6  All Thy goal in us attain.

Hymns, #1349
High Peak of the Divine Revelation

E1349 Cf5 K- S- T-

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Clement C. Scholefield, Thomas Campbell
Meter
:
8.8.8.8.8.8. with repeat

Hymns using same tune:
#296, #499, #500
*Repeat the last two lines of verses 1-3
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3   4 
 
 
 1  What miracle! What mystery!
 1  That God and man should blended be!
 1  God became man to make man God,
 1  Untraceable economy!
 1  From His good pleasure, heart's desire,
 1  His highest goal attained will be.
 
 2  Flesh He became, the first God-man,
 2  His pleasure that I God may be:
 2  In life and nature I'm God's kind,
 2  Though Godhead's His exclusively.
 2  His attributes my virtues are;
 2  His glorious image shines through me.
 
 3  No longer I alone that live,
 3  But God together lives with me.
 3  Built with the saints in the Triune God,
 3  His universal house we'll be,
 3  And His organic Body we
 3  For His expression corp'rately.
 
 4  Jerusalem, the ultimate,
 4  Of visions the totality;
 4  The Triune God, tripartite man -
 4  A loving pair eternally -
 4  As man yet God they coinhere,
 4  A mutual dwelling place to be;
 4  God's glory in humanity
 4  Shines forth in splendor radiantly!
 
Verses:  1   2   3   4

Hymns, #1350
High Peak of the Divine Revelation

E- C- K- S- T-

Lyrics
:
Witness Lee
Music
:
Unknown
Meter
:
Peculiar Meter

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
 
God's eternal economy is to make man the same as He is
In life and nature but not in the Godhead
And to make Himself one with man and man one with Him,
Thus to be enlarged and expanded in His expression,
That all His divine - that all His divine -
Attributes may be expressed in human virtues.
 
Home | Top | Go To | Prev | Next









Hymns, #1351
Experience of Christ - As Life

E- C- K- S- T-

Lyrics
:
Unknown
Music
:
Unknown
Meter
:
Peculiar Meter

This hymn has a unique tune
Home | Go To | Prev | Next
Verses:  1   2   3 
 
 1  Christ has come to be life, the processed divine Trinity.
 1  God the Father's the source, a fountain emerging to be.
 1  God the Son as a gushing up spring,
 1  In the Spirit a river for life imparting.
 1  Oh, how can this miracle be? The Triune God flowing in me!
 1  Oh, I've got rivers of life flowing out of my innermost being!
 1  I've got rivers of life flowing out of my innermost being!
 
As this life flows through me, I'm supplied abundantly.
His life nullifies sin!
Power springs now from within!
To be free, overcoming spontaneously.
 
 2  Yet this life though it frees, is not meant for mere victory.
 2  God is full of intent and never could flow aimlessly.
 2  So this life has a totality, a consummate issue encompassing me.
 2  Life moves and life grows, life shapes as it flows
 2  Now I share in this life's destiny.
 2  Oh, I've got rivers of life flowing out of my innermost being!
 2  I've got rivers of life flowing out of my innermost being!
 
We'll abide mutually, God and man revealed to be
Lamb, Wife, Spirit, and Bride.
Come! Drink! And riverside,
Grows the tree, our enjoyment for eternity!
 
 3  So I've no cause to frown as one who's received this zoe.
 3  I know life runs its course and triumphs inevitably.
 3  I'm required just to stay in the flow,
 3  If I do the drinking then God gives the growth.
 3  So there's joy in my heart, and a spring in my step,
 3  And a smile on my face as I sing,
 3  Oh, I've got rivers of life flowing out of my innermost being!
 3  I've got rivers of life flowing out of my innermost being!
 
Verses:  1   2   3
